WINSTORY_NAME: Data Intensity: Autonomous Database OLTP
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Data Intensity is a Oracle Partners and already uses on-premise technology. This deal was is an example of growth and rising operational cost. DI is looking quadruple their 30 users today; while keeping resources focused on customers, not internal upkeep of systems. DI wanted better performance in terms of data ingestion & processing, reduce operational overhead and faster time to market.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
DI sees ADW as a game changer because many of their customers want high performance, elasticity and ease of implementation without getting bogged down by the underlying infrastructure. 
Less time configuring and maintaining the data warehouse.
5X performance improvement. 
Competitive edge by providing better service and savings to their end customers.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: The business in uniquely positioned to offer its customers a way to quickly add new data sources to make intelligent business decisions. Commitment to consistent adoption of Oracle’s cutting edge cloud platform technologies. Reduced footprint by 2X compared to On Premise.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: DI was already using OCI for hosting their customers' EBS environment. With ADWC they are able to reduce operation & maintenance overhead, and expand their customer base at a lower total cost of ownership. DI does not have to worry about infrastructure, downtime, patching, which beings down their administration cost.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Data Intensity is a long-time Oracle Platinum Partner, with a focus on EBS applications, DBCS, OCI, Paas and SaaS.

WINSTORY_NAME: GreyStone Power Corporation: Apex Cloud Services
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Greystone was under audit. They chose to maintain the relationship with Oracle due to the trust & relationship that the SMB team created with them. Apex applications are a critical company- wide tool. They develop Apex dashboards that are delivered daily to support their business users, operations and Executive reporting requirements. Also, the overall cost of  licensing, maintaining and supporting on premise EE databases & Apex applications with a small IT staff.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The MIS Director was engaged by the sales team via email, phone and LinkedIn prospecting efforts. One of our first LinkedIn messages, delivered after OpenWorld, caught the attention of the MIS Director and the cycle began from there. SMB Cloud led this sales cycle with phone based requirements gathering and one on site visit.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Our team learned that this customer needed to have a positive experience with Oracle. They were under audit and appreciated that our SMB team was able to present them with the Cloud based solutions that matched their business requirements while saving time and money. Our team learned that onsite visits made an impact on this customer team. We learned that working with the developer level to the management level during the sales cycle created a customer confidence that made a difference in our ability to close this deal in a relatively short timeline to secure a late Q2 win.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: The benefit to the customer is the ability to maintain their business process of using Apex applications while reducing costs and leveraging the scalability of our Cloud platform.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Build and Extend Apps with PaaS & IaaS - Move Workloads ot IaaS & PaaS -Apex Cloud Services

WINSTORY_USECASE: Exa Cloud@Customer Migration
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q1: Exa Cloud@Customer was the best solution to improve the speed, accuracy, and security of their fund transactions.
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q2: Fundserv was ready for the efficiencies and cost savings the Oracle Cloud has to offer. However, the sensitive nature of their client financial data prevented them from a public cloud option. In Q4 FY19, SMB Cloud Platform Manager John Whitchurch proved to Fundserv that Exa Cloud@Customer was the best solution to improve the speed, accuracy, and security of their fund transactions.
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q3: They wanted their IT staff to expertly run and maintain their new system. John brought in NAC Consulting Sales Rep Gabby Marino to better understand Fundserv’s objectives. Gabby crafted a plan to migrate five databases. Then, once successful, Fundserv would complete an additional five migrations with Consulting.
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q4: "Staying involved with Fundserv through the entire sales cycle had a tremendous payoff with two wins last quarter. I am grateful for the collaboration with the SMB Cloud Platform and Consulting Portfolio teams to guide Fundserv toward self-sufficiency.” - Matt Bhaya, NAC Consulting Sales Rep.

WINSTORY_NAME: Energy Transfer - Exadata Cloud@Customer
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Lanese.Turner@oracle.com, Manish.Chopra@oracle.com, Philip.Papadopoulos@oracle.com, Greg.Furman@oracle.com, Nick.Colon@oracle.com, Adam.Janbolat@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: null
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: null
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: null
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: null
WINSTORY_USECASE: Migrated 60 databases to Exadata Cloud@Customer (ExaCC)
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q1: The impact to Energy Transfer was scalability, agility and performance; ExaCC also improved Energy’s ability to respond to market conditions and onboard acquisitions.
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q2: Energy Transfer has been an Oracle customer for some time, with significant investment running Oracle DB on SPARC. The company has experienced rapid growth including several acquisitions leading it to focus on improving business agility amidst expansion. These factors, including a hardware refresh decision, led Energy Transfer to look for alternatives to the Oracle database running on SPARC.
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q3:
1)Leveraged the new Exadata Cloud Machine pricing
2)Stressed the all-inclusive OCPU that included all database options
3)Structured an annual commit consumption model
4)Secured approval for an effective 8 year contract
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q4: One of the first lessons learned with Energy Transfer is existing SPARC customers represent both an opportunity and a risk. Proactively talking with SPARC customers that are looking to the future is critical. Another lesson learned is account teams shouldn’t be afraid to “go outside the box” when it comes to constructing terms, conditions and contracts that meet customer needs. Finally, the team learned that it’s important to understand DAS and CPQ process details in order to work through roadblocks and unique contract requirements.

WINSTORY_NAME: Altec Industires: Move and Improve to Exa Cloud Service for EBS, PSFT and ATG
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Customer was seeing poor performance on EBS/ASCP which runs almost all of their day to day business.  In particular the Advanced Supply Chain module which they run nightly was taking 12 to 14 hours to complete.  This was causing downtime in the business as the supply chain run often extended into the next business day and held up operations.  Altec was also at a crossroads regarding the future of EBS and if they were ready to start investing in SaaS applications.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Started the process 30 months ago, but Altec was not ready to move to OCI.  We continued to stay engaged at both the executive and technical level with Altec.  In July of 2019 the customer agreed let us prove out OCI via a POC.  We engaged the Oracle IaaS and Application Development team to help the ECA team with the POC.  We did a full conversion of SPARC to Linux and executed a successful POC which included a in depth sizing exercise to learn Altec’s environment.  The next step was to determine who would be their “run and maintain” partner.  At this point we began engaging with IBM who was the incumbent for run and maintain.  We then partnered with IBM on a deal structure that would allow IBM to manage Altec’s environment on OCI via a MSP agreement.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Engage your product and specialist technical teams (need the best SME’s for critical deals)
Align the Oracle executive team to the customer executive team 
Be open to working with partners (in this case IBM, who was the current MSP)
Know your reference stories (confidence in the message, clients don’t want to be the first)
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Customer saw massive performance gains when running on OCI.  The supply chain process that was taking 14 hours to complete, was now running in less than three hours.  With supply chain not running into the next business day, the customer will be able to realize more full days of manufacturing production.  Altec was also able to buy themselves some additional time on determining what their journey to SaaS will look like.  OCI has given new life to multiple EBS modules that the customer was looking to replace (ASCP and Configurator), which saved them significant dollars and minimized risk to the business.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Move and Improve to Exa Cloud Service for EBS, PSFT and ATG

WINSTORY_NAME: White Cloud Security: Move Workloads to IaaS and PaaS
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
- White Cloud Security is building a next-generation application to protect its customers
- They did not want to run their own infrastructure, so they were exploring cloud options
- They already had various AWS installations, but wanted a better offering for the large number of its customers who wanted Oracle-based protection
- The customer had limited in-house Oracle expertise, and no Oracle Cloud expertise
- They needed a platform from which to offer its new application to its many Oracle customers
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
- During pre-sales, Cintra used its proven blueprinted Oracle Cloud architecture designs to offer White Cloud Security a number of options for its Oracle Cloud platform, all of which met Velocity criteria.  A Cloud Demo was conducted to show future state.
- Cintra worked closely with White Cloud Security’s C-level management team to ensure what we were deploying genuinely met the company’s needs.  Cintra provided a full TCO / ROI document
- Cintra has been on-hand throughout the project to provide Oracle Cloud expertise, to ensure the platform meets the needs of White Cloud Security and its customers
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Cintra provided the necessary expertise to ensure a successful deployment, resulting is a successful cloud migration. The Clients’ implementation was accelerated due in part to Cintra’s Rapid Cloud methodology. Using the cloud meant White Cloud Security could eliminate the need to procure and operate its own infrastructure, and Cintra identified that Oracle Cloud provided a better solution for its Oracle-based customers than AWS
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT:
- This deal enables White Cloud Security to expand its product and service portfolio 
- White Cloud was able to start testing in the Oracle Cloud as early as the first month of their 12-month term

WINSTORY_NAME: Ivy Tech Community College - EXA Cloud@Customer
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Ivy Tech Community College, one of the largest CCs in the country with 200K students and 40 locations, needed to modernize their Banner infrastructure to meet the needs of their students and staff. Additionally, during the conversations, the rep discovered that AWS Redshift was no longer able to scale to accommodate their growing data requirements and they were looking at Snowflake.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Over a period of two years, the rep collected insights into the customer’s needs and built relationships with key stakeholders. In addition to the need to move their Banner into a hybrid cloud environment, the rep uncovered the desire for a new Data Warehouse. AWS Redshift no longer met their increasing data and performance needs. The rep suggested they look at ADW, but at the time it was new and untested. For the customer Snowflake was the less risky option. In July, once the customer completed other priority projects, the rep re-introduced the solution. Pitching Exadata Cloud @ Customer for their lift and shift of Banner, he provided their TCO and how the solution met the strategic goals of the institution for not only Banner, but also their DWH. Looking at the numbers, the CTO and CIO knew it made sense and committed. The rep presented a comprehensive BOM that covered Ivy Tech’s requirements across Lift and Shift, Data Warehouse, and Integration.  The customer gave the go ahead.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Get executive sponsorship from above. Nothing moves forward without it. Do you homework before going in and design a compelling pitch  Lead with a value hypothesis, ask for their executive sponsorship to let Oracle validate that with their team.  Once validated, it becomes apparent that Oracle is the only partner uniquely qualified to meet all of their strategic, financial, and operational requirements.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: The customer’s first priority is migration to Exadata C@C. Over the next six months, they will be migrating Banner from the on-premise system to Exadata Cloud@Customer + DR/Business Continuity in public cloud on Exadata Cloud Service and OCI. Once they have that in place, the next priority will be to migrate their AWS Redshift environment to ADW, effectively blocking Snowflake and taking out AWS Redshift.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Lift & Shift to improve performance  - EXA Cloud@Customer

WINSTORY_NAME: WL Gore: OCI Move & Improve
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: WL Gore has been running PSFT in DXC Datacenters for 10+ years, and they have aging hardware and a DC agreement renewal approaching. They were open to exploring options to enable the org’s digital modernization agenda by moving PSFT to a public cloud provider.  On-premise deployment in  the DXC datacenter was limiting Gore’s ability to rapidly adopt new technologies.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The Oracle Account team had previously engaged with WL Gore to secure a cloud win for an ETL opportunity. Through that engagement, the account team established working relationships with the Enterprise Architecture team, who was very adamant that they have an AWS mandate.  Relationships established led to the sharing of the HR LoB’s intention to move PSFT to public cloud (AWS being the default per the mandate). The account team engaged with DXC team directly.  Through strong partnering, the Oracle account team and DXC were able to demonstrate the OCI price & performance advantages of moving an Oracle workload to OCI. The Oracle team leveraged DXC’s long standing relationship with Gore’s HR leadership and with a strong economic proposal favoring OCI, Oracle and DXC were able to convince Gore to forgo a POC.  Oracle engaged in the sales cycle for 4 months showing the compelling economic advantages of OCI over the competition. This accelerated commercial negotiations, and the streamlining of the procurement process.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Establishing Win/Win with partners who have long histories with our clients is crucial.  This deal would likely have gone to AWS if Oracle and DXC team had not collaborated effectively, creating a win/win scenario for all parties involved in the transaction.  Oracle secured the OCI deal.  DXC grows their MSP deal by 30% in adding OCI into the agreement.  WL Gore gains better price & performance by partnering with Oracle Cloud and DXC.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: In lifting and shifting PSFT to OCI, WL Gore will be reducing cost while also gaining a performance increase for PSFT.  In phase 2 of this project, OCI will provide a low cost DR solution using cloud technology, further reducing TCO.  Gore able to exit the DXC datacenter, an ambition for Gore and a recommendation from the DXC team.  The project is also enabling Gore to more rapidly adopt leading edge technologies.
WINSTORY_USECASE: OCI Move & Improve

WINSTORY_NAME: Rosendin Electric: - Oracle Autonomous Date Warehouse
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Rosendin has limited staff (DBA) and runs a lean IT department. The customer didn’t want to hire a person specifically for Snowflake or to work on an OCI Database.  ADW met their requirements because the autonomous features meant that they can continue to run a lean and efficient team.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Discovery on data warehouse requirements and goals, Oracle positioned ADW as the preferred solution with benefit and value justifications. Instead of pushing products on the customer, we spent a lot of time understanding their requirements and needs.  This built the trust with the customer, as they knew that we were there as solution provider not product pusher.  We spoke of different options once we understood their data warehouse requirements; Database CS, Exadata CS, and ADW.  However, ADW stood out because we learned that they have a lean IT department and hiring more people wasn’t in their plan.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Become the trusted advisor and focus on understanding the customer’s business requirements.  Build a solution based on their requirements, then talk about technologies that will help implement the solution.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Implementation of ADW was a breeze.  Provisioning was simple, using Oracle Data Integrator to move data from sources into ADW, and on-going management of ADW was minimized from the IT team.
WINSTORY_USECASE:
FY20 Autonomous Data Warehouse /FY20 Build & Extend Apps with PaaS & IaaS / FY20 Integration Apps & Data / FY20 Move Workloads to IaaS & PaaS
FY20 Data Analytics for Business & IT

WINSTORY_NAME: 7 Eleven: Exadata for High Performance Workloads
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: The 7-Eleven executives were concerned that a concurrent retail rollout slated to launch in June made the endeavor too risky. The Oracle team responded with creativity, identifying workloads that would be unaffected by the retail launch, moving those to the cloud separately, and demonstrating the performance gains. However, when challenging Q1 results at 7-11 led to a suspension of all future deals, the team at Oracle had to once again brainstorm a mutually beneficial solution.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The account team approached the CIO and CTO with the support of  Oracle’s Enterprise Architect Group VP, Chris Fox , and Cloud Business Value Architect, Charles Njendu, to craft a strong ROI case against freezing the deal. Backed by the continuing technical efforts of Solutions Architect, Sanjay Basu, and Software Engineer Brad Briggs, Oracle showcased their foresight and earned 7-11’s confidence. After a final presentation to the 7-11 board of directors and CEO, they closed the deal. The implementation includes a $650K contract with NAC Consulting, which will provide services and perform the move and improve under the supervision of Oracle Consulting Director Lanese Turner.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: The team at Oracle had to brainstorm a mutually beneficial solution.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: The account team approached the CIO and CTO with the support of  Oracle’s Enterprise Architect Group VP, Chris Fox , and Cloud Business Value Architect, Charles Njendu, to craft a strong ROI case against freezing the deal. Backed by the continuing technical efforts of Solutions Architect, Sanjay Basu, and Software Engineer Brad Briggs, Oracle showcased their foresight and earned 7-11’s confidence. After a final presentation to the 7-11 board of directors and CEO, they closed the deal. The implementation includes a $650K contract with NAC Consulting, which will provide services and perform the move and improve under the supervision of Oracle Consulting Director Lanese Turner.
WINSTORY_USECASE: FY20 Exadata for High Performance Workloads

WINSTORY_NAME: Delphic Software - PayGo
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Delphic Software is looking to expand into Europe and other regions and need to comply with the data residency laws.  The customer was using forms and reports earlier and migrated to APEX. Autonomous with APEX made sense to customer so that they can focus on the application enhancement rather maintaining the databases, security and licenses.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: We had a discovery call with the customer and we identified the use case and explained the advantages of using ATP-APEX and also switching to cloud since it will align with customer’s business goal. We did a demo for the customer where we showed the ease of using ATP-APEX and then signed them up for a PayGo. Post-Sales: we continued working with the customer to setup there test environment.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Identifying business pains, technical pains and internal company challenges early in the sales cycle helped us to do a better business value proposition to the customer. Focus more on identifying the key pain points and future business goals early in the sales cycle. For a faster consumption rate, figure out early in the sales cycle what can cause the delay in project implementation. Internal challenges, customer dependencies etc.

WINSTORY_NAME: Naveego: Move Data Cleansing Application Workloads to OCI
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Scalabiltiy, cost savings and a hands-on approach
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
It was Nav Kala’s first month as an SMB Cloud Rep when he met with the CEO, the CTO, and a senior engineer at data quality management company Naveego. 
When Nav and his team first reached out, Naveego was already showing some interest in Oracle Cloud. They were entrenched with Amazon Web Services but questioned whether it would be their best option moving forward with their plans for aggressive growth. 
When Nav sat down to discuss a potential relationship, he didn’t start by touting OCI’s cost-savings, feeling that would’ve been too assumptive. Instead he focused on understanding Naveego’s current and future business challenges.

Nav learned about Naveego’s focus on scaling in those discussions, which proved to be invaluable. The Oracle team evaluated their AWS bill using projected growth figures. Showing Naveego where they could expect to save money with OCI today and in the future was game-changing.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Whenever we needed an executive to get on a call, it happened. Our VP Rajat Dham, my regional manager Cory Rice, GVP Kenyon Arens – they all stepped up to build that trust with Naveego and give them assurance. Meanwhile, Naveego never even knew their AWS rep’s name.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: For Naveego’s CEO, keeping costs low while scaling was key, and it was clear that they could save upwards of 70% on networking alone with OCI. That cost-savings, coupled with a more hands-on approach that included executive alignment, put Oracle in a league above AWS.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Move Data Cleansing Application Workloads to OCI

WINSTORY_NAME: Geico: ADW
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: GEICO is always looking for ways to be more efficient and cost-effective. It was only a matter of time before the cost-savings and improved efficiencies of cloud computing enticed the company to move out of the on-prem world.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Despite the Oracle team wanting to move forward and reposition the relationship on stronger terms, they let the customer define the pace of the rollout by offering delayed provisioning and billing. With this approach, the deal closed within a few months
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: “We could have taken the chargeback and left it alone – but we were able to turn that negative into a positive,” says Youngs. “We’d spent a lot of time building the relationship and understanding their challenges and knew we could expand on that.”

WINSTORY_NAME: The Washington Post: Integration Apps & Data
WINSTORY_PARTNER: OIC – eAllianceDigital Assistant – Fishbowl Solutions
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: For more than a decade, the Post had been working with Oracle as an EBS and Hyperion customer, but the relationship saw little partnership and expansion. Earlier in 2019, the Oracle Account team led by Cloud Platform Rep Alex Franco, put an emphasis on getting engaged in discussions regarding the Post’s digital transformation and helping them evaluate different solutions and architectures for a modern, cloud-based technology approach
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The ECA team, led by Manoj Gupta, worked with Product Management and the Hub ECA team to build out a proven use case and stand up an abbreviated and inexpensive PoC. Staged within just two months with a limited budget, the test was successful and won the confidence of the Post team, leading to an initial close in July.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: This deal was a great example of how our entire team plays a part and work in tandem to introduce a customer to our cloud technologies at a low cost of entry. The key was to start small and build on the success from there.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: The Post was looking to automate traditionally manual Financial and Accounting processes and do more with less to stay competitive,” says Franco. “They see their future in the cloud, and they’re ready for some drastic changes
WINSTORY_USECASE: Integration, App Dev, Security & Lift and Shift

WINSTORY_NAME: Corelogic Build & Extend Apps with PaaS & IaaS
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: From their existing PaaS investment, we proposed a Midterm Conversion to the Universal Credit Model. CoreLogic is a Cloud-forward company with Oracle, AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud environments installed
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The customer was spending approximately $25M/year with AWS, our PaaS footprint was 1% of this. To preserve our PaaS footprint and remain competitive, we knew this deal was an instrumental strategy to lay the groundwork for future Oracle PaaS and IaaS expansion. We determined a Midterm Conversion was the best solution in order for CoreLogic to maximize the value of their existing investment and utilize the flexibility of the Universal Credit Model.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: The customer saw the ultimate value in the cost savings. Our proposal was more than 2x the remaining TCV, but it added one more year to the contract – making it a 4 year term from the original 3 year term. The incremental ARR was $50k from $226k to $276k.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: This was a perfect opportunity for a Midterm Conversion to the Universal Credit Model. The digital transformation of all their back-office applications (EBS, OEM, CPQ, SFDC) go-live was the compelling event for this deal. CoreLogic ran out of ICS connections from their past PaaS investment, and the customer wanted to leverage the expanded offering of OAIC to architect this project as well as integrate their Oracle SaaS applications with OAIC.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Build & Extend Apps with PaaS & IaaS

WINSTORY_NAME: AIG: Platform Modernization – ExaCC
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: The team worked across three LOB’s to consolidate workloads, reduce cost by sharing capacities and lower current run rates.  By leveraging AIG’s Exadata experience, the Cloud-at-Customer platform provided a cloud option behind AIG’s firewall.  The high-performance architecture, data encryption and an elastic consumption model will enable AIG to shift key workloads from AIX, Netezza and DB2 and for Oracle to gain a cloud footprint at AIG.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
Bursting via UCC
Cost savings with move off current system (Netezza & AIX)
Platform performance issues (Netezza)
Business Realignment and move to cloud infrastructure
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: By working with the LOB’s we were able to identify key areas of opportunity and provide a solution to win over IBM and gain a footprint against AWS and Azure.  Working through a Partner brought additional complexities, slowing the process initially, but will ensure a speedier expansion moving forward.  ExadataCC is providing AIG with a workable path to the cloud and givens us a competitive advantage over AWS with BI Data Analytics Cloud-at-Customer and position our latest suite of products including Autonomous.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: In an effort to improve the underwriting process, AIG is looking to move several hundred applications to cloud concentrating on compute-centric & small database workloads.  These target migrations will meet or exceed cloud standards driven by AWS and Azure in the account
WINSTORY_USECASE: Platform Modernization – ExaCC

WINSTORY_NAME: Construction Specialties: OAC

From a Pre-Sales Engineering perspective, we helped the customer deploy, OAC and ADWC. Troubleshoot errors with BICC and OAC 5.3, and several hours of post sale support. The customer also went through an OCI-C to OCI migration where we assisted during the sales process to solidify the relationship.

Oracle is a service company. Post Sales support, guidance and training are paramount to customer success.

WINSTORY_NAME: Trade One Marketing - BrandMuscle - Move Workoads to IaaS & PaaS
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
- Reducing IT footprint (AWS Bill was high)
- The need for Transparent Data Encryption (Included in SE DBCS)
- The need for better scalability for internal and customer facing apps
- Durable and Scalable storage
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
- Mythics pre sales hosted a cloud discovery assessment &  workshop with the customer  to define  the OCI solution which reduced system latency, improved security and provided multi tenancy.  
- Mythics pre sales completed a TCO Analysis and designed the Oracle Cloud Architecture. 
- Mythics  pre sales also provided a migration and implementation plan.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Oracle’s  Cloud Infrastructure  and DB Services provided an ideal platform for Trade One Marketing to move their business critical applications easily to a more cost effective, secure and higher performing environment .
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Trade One Marketing - BrandMuscle moved their application tier and On-premise Oracle Databases (DB Tier) over to OCI VM’s. The application that’s supported by the Oracle database is a legacy backend system that’s utilized internally, and the secondary application is a customer facing application - all was moved from AWS to Oracle Cloud. Sales team added PaaS Database Cloud Service due to the customer’s security requirement: Transparent Data Encryption.

WINSTORY_NAME: Entravision Communication - PayGo
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Entravision wants to become hoarders of data while automating the process of gathering, cleansing, and leveraging data.  In the short term, they would like to empower their sales staff to better match advertisers target market with Entravision’s audience.  In the long term, Entravision would like to build an algorithm to price their ad space in real time based on variable parameters.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: 2 Projects: 1) CPQ data: PoC of ADWCS vs Snowflake to be decided in 3 weeks and go live Jan 1st.  2) PAYG FCC Data: Object storage & ADWCS go live before Thanksgiving.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Make the conversation about the numbers and get specific (4-10x performant on throughput, latency, etc and 50% less because of difference in networking, egress charges). “If it is 4-10x more performant and 50% less, why wouldn’t you try it”
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Performance and Cost

WINSTORY_NAME: C&S Wholesale Grocer
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: C&S had limited transparency into financial results and operational drivers due to the tabular nature of existing reports. Extensive manual efforts were required to generate and maintain in excel, smartview and financial reports. Executives did not have a good view into the enterprise.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The NAC rep collaborated with Apps rep to obtain a meeting and give an update on Oracle’s latest and greatest. The Oracle team focused on building relationships and use cases within the Fiance LOB and outside of IT. Oracle drove the sales cycle with Peloton to identify a solution, and created an implementation plan and gain approval from CEO and CFO for the project. We avoided a POC and were able to close this in Q1 with a phased approach with plans to expand.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: It is important to build internal Oracle relationships within the different pillars to help tell the Oracle story. We were aware of the politics between Finance and IT and went to the CEO for approval before going to the CIO. We were heavily focused on building a trusting  relationship with open communication in the account which has driven additional opportunities, increased engagement in events, but also has helped change the hearts and minds of how the custommer views Oracle.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT:
- C&S has an opportunity to drive agility and efficiency in their reporting and analytic processes through an enabling technology, which enables them to focus on more value added analysis to facilitate future growth
- Deliver enhanced ad-hoc reporting capabilities, reduce manual effort and provide more agile reporting and decision making
- Provide streamlined dashboard and reporting capabilities to key information
- Implement a scalable and extensible technology architecture that can scale multiple lines of business within the organization.
WINSTORY_USECASE: C&S is looking to establish advanced analytics, dashboards and a reporting platform with a focus on reducing manual effort, driving significant value to the business and better enabling the organization with tools to make informed business decisions.

WINSTORY_NAME: United States Cold Storage: Custom App (eWM) hosted in OCI
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: In order to increase efficiency, US Cold acknowledged the need to improve the performance of their business systems.  US Cold’s Proprietary Warehouse Management application, which ran on AS400 and DB2 for 15+ years, was the target for the first wave of modernization.  In order to modernize and scale more efficiently, the customer intended to  re-write the application to run on Oracle DB and move the application to a Public Cloud Infrastructure (Azure).
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
US Cold is a greenfield account.  After gathering G2 from account research and Sales Cloud, the account team engaged directly with CIO to validate the interest in re-writing their application on an Oracle DB.  The Oracle team was successful in engaging US Cold for first meeting in late September 2019. The 
Customer’s initial intention was to have application hosted in Azure while running on Oracle DB. After weeks of educating US Cold on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, their CIO committed to a POC in OCI.   The 8 week POC enabled Oracle Cloud team to to prove OCI’s superior performance.  Upon exiting the POC, the CIO acknowledged the economical and technical superiority of OCI vs Azure. Oracle had the technical win in hand, and with that the account team was able to negotiate commercial terms with minimal concessions.  5 Month Sale Cycle from initial outreach to close.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Greenfield accounts are worthy of effort.  Gather intelligence on account, formulate an executive hypothesis, and engage strategically at the executive level.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: As validated by extensive load and stress testing, US Cold realized a 2.5x gain in DB performance when running Oracle vs DB2.  By hosting their application in OCI rather than Azure, US Cold realized a 3X performance gain over Azure, while reducing cost of DB licensing significantly and enabling the business to adopt the preferred OPEX model.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Custom App (eWM) hosted in OCI

WINSTORY_NAME: HCSC: Analytics Cloud and Autonomous Datawarehouse
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: The cost centers’ numerous profit-and-loss owners were in constant need of real-time financials to stay on-budget. Manual journal entries exchanged among cost centers became an ever-expanding hindrance on time, money, and resources. The CFO began to investigate solutions like Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) and Amazon Web Services with the ambition of providing autonomy to cost centers, fostering increased accountability through transparency and streamlining processes.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: HCSC initially considered building a solution in-house, but also engaged with Oracle given the complexity of the project. The Oracle team proposed a solution driven by OAC and Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW), which would grant the CFO a solution that was quicker to implement, easier to manage, and provided more efficient analytics than a home-grown solution could. And as forecasts revealed that HCSC might need three times their current peak usage of data, the scalability of the cloud cemented OAC and ADW as the best way forward.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: This was a packaged solution so IT involvement could be kept to a minimum, which was a selling point for the CFO spearheading this project.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Because HCSC is always eager to see what technological advances can do, the future of the account and potential impact of AI is strong. Now in the testing phase, HCSC will soon be at the top of its financial game with plenty of headroom to stay there for years to come
WINSTORY_USECASE: Cost Center Analytics & Reporting

WINSTORY_NAME: Restoration Hardware - Data Mart and Analytics for Finance
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Finance team was primarily using excel for reporting, and their abilities to accurately analyze data/build out reports was limited and time consuming.  They were leveraging data from multiple different data sources (Oracle ERP and 50-60 different Access Databases) and did not have a central repository.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The opportunity originated with the BDC rep, Kenneth Kwon, who made contact with the Sr. Apps Lead at RH.  The Director of Apps and Accounting was looped in, and Kenneth engaged our ADB Land Team and our SC Harish to help progress conversations. Together we uncovered the finance team was tasked with building out reports for HR, Finance and Marketing and needed to pull data from multiple sources with different formats. The Oracle team positioned an ADW + OAC guided testing period to prove that we could help Restoration Hardware spin up and analyze reports faster. We kicked off the POC and met regularly (sometimes up to 3x a week) working through the milestones and next steps. Upon accomplishing the success criteria at the end of the trial period, RH felt comfortable converting their trial to a paid subscription model and we closed the deal about a week and a half later.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Agree upon success criteria with the customer upfront and from there build out a mutual success plan.   
Leverage both to work backwards from the trial end date and build out milestones with specific dates to work towards execution by that date
There was massive coordination between our SC and sales team to ensure we could continuously meet these milestones .
You can’t win alone; work together.  Maintain tight alignment between BDC, LAND and Field.  Leverage all of your resources
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Self-service reporting for Finance, a separate data mart specifically for Finance which relieves IT from having to meet SOX compliance standards with their Enterprise Data Warehouse, and a standardized analytical tool for data models and ad-hoc reporting for Finance
WINSTORY_USECASE: Data Mart and Analytics for Finance (LAND GTM)

WINSTORY_NAME: Doosan:  OCI Renewal of EBS hosting environment
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: In strategic planning meetings with Doosan Bobcat’s CIO, he made it clear that one of his top goals for 2019 was achieving IT cost reduction.  His direction to the Oracle team was to bring him ideas to deliver better infrastructure efficiencies.  The CIO was also very reliant on his chief architect for guidance, who was a AWS advocate and champion.  In fact, he actively campaigned against Oracle cloud solutions.  It became clear that any solution we brought to the CIO must carry enough business value to over-rule objections from the Chief Architect.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: In order to prevent a pivot to AWS, we knew that protecting the OCI tenancies was critical.  Our best way to defend against loss of the subscription was to lock in a long-term renewal.  However, the EBS ERP environment was not up for renewal until May 30, 2020.  Since time was our enemy in this situation, we devised a plan to encourage Doosan Bobcat to commit to an early renewal – thus blocking a threat of migration to AWS.  Upon analysis, it became clear that Doosan’s total OCI spend qualified them for an improved rate card discount.  In exchange for an early renewal, Doosan received a modest discount and a right sizing of the commit to match their consumption.  Month over month consumption was approximately 80% of monthly commitment.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: The sales team created a sense of urgency by reinforcing a firm offer expiration date.  In addition, we developed and presented convincing TCO reduction proofs.  Lastly, building and maintaining trusted relationships with IT leadership and purchasing stakeholders who were tasked with comparing the OCI and AWS business cases enabled us to close the deal in late-December, 2019.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Reduced infrastructure TCO, right-sized UCC commit
WINSTORY_USECASE: OCI Renewal of EBS hosting environment

WINSTORY_NAME: Adventist Health: OAC for FP&A and ADW for Clinical Data Warehouse
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
Analytics: AH needed to pull ERP, EPM, and HCM data into one report for Budget Variance, Labor Cost Analysis and securely manage report delivery to the 1000 department owners. AH legacy solution was using Tableau, McKesson, Fusion Analytics and PBCS to produce end user reporting.  Legacy solution was not meeting end user expectation, was difficult to administer, and was cost prohibitive to scale.
Clinical Data Warehouse: The AH BI team needed to refresh the failing infrastructure supporting its main Clinical Data Warehouse. Cerner was hosting the Oracle 11g database in Cerner’s Kansas City data center. AH does not want to be in the data center maintenance/operations business. Cost prohibitive to renew the Hosting contract with Cerner.
Organizational Accountability: The FP&A LOB is operating and maintaining the Analytics solution on OCI-C. AH wants to move the accountability to the corporate BI Team that is maintaining and operating the Clinical Data Warehouse on OCI.
UCC contract overages: AH was running monthly overages on both the Analytics on OCI-C and the ADW on OCI environments.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Adventist Health is a new account to Mid Market West for FY20. Focused on building relationships with the FP&A LOB and the corporate BI Team. Positioned the economics of UCC contract consolidation and monthly commit expansion for more predictable BI department budgeting and AP. Worked through Oracle PMO to get approval for OCS led migration of Analytics environment to OCI.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Adventist Health is growing their Oracle Cloud footprint use case by use case. Land – Adopt – Expand is the key lesson learned. Establishing executive and operating management relationships across multiple LOB’s is central to creating Business Champions for Oracle. Partnering with those Business Champions to drive user adoption of Oracle solutions results in expanded consumption.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: 1. Consolidated contract better reflects AH monthly consumption of OCI cloud services. 2. Organizational alignment for maintaining and operating the OCI tenancy for FP&A analytics and Clinical Data Warehouse. 3. A single Oracle Cloud Platform for future data management and business analytics workloads.

WINSTORY_NAME: Ford Motor Company: Turns the corner with Exadata
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
Database migration, performance and consolidation. 
Performance & Cost compared to traditional on premise HP Hardware
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: 3 main sales leads were Kelly Collins - KAD, Ryan Cassar - CPR, and Shaibal Talukder - ECA.  The process starting with the long journey of working to renew and rejuvenate a somewhat sour relationship with Ford which over the course of 3 years we were able to do.  After countless in depth discovery sessions with Ford into their large database estate we determined we could save Ford millions of dollars in costs, increase the performance of their connected systems, and require less Ford intervention to manage. We provided several presentations that focused on the business benefits ford could expect to receive including but not limited to increased agility, faster time to market, increased security, on top of the cost savings aforementioned.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Ensure you understand the internal politics of your customer and how these will play a role within each stage of the sales process.  Ensure all team communications are in line with the overall message avoiding any mismessaging.  Present a thorough business case showcasing the areas where the customer can expect to receive benefits from day 1.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Reduced maunual intervention, decrease TCO, better performance, reallocated human capital to more strategic initiatives
WINSTORY_USECASE: Exadata for High Performance Workloads

WINSTORY_NAME: Informatica: Autonomous Datawarehouse and OCI
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Informatica had to shut down it’s datacenters and migrate to a cloud model by 2021 . The intention was to be a data-centerless company before they go public. They had to migrate 1200 custom applications with 95% using the Oracle backend. Informatica did not have an effective orchestration framework/model in place to handle their IT support workloads all around the globe and the resolution time use to take weeks especially in follow the sun model. Significant time and resources were spent in insignificant tasks like patching/upgrades etc. and in 2019 they experienced security breaches related to customer infotmation. Their training platform used to run on Oracle Ravello which was End of Life’d and they were evaluating alternate technologies.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
The sales process was going on for almost a year. Oracle consulting services and the Oracle solution Hub’s were instrumental in helping the customer with multiple POC’s to gauge price/performance around the 3 areas:
•	Lift and shift of on-prem global support IT and ticketing apps running on Oracle DB to DBCS
•	Non-critical internal Training workloads on Apex and ADW
•	Docker Kubernetes for issue resolution
Additionally, the solution hubs had to develop a custom portal using APEX and ADW to publish their support and training workloads. As this custom application did not have a proper support model, we engaged OCS to provided Day 2 services to ensure clean migration and go-live within the critical timelines.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
•	Engage early. Definitely show the value of OCI through POC’s. We always provide consistent performance compared to AWS/Azure.
•	Train the operations users and the cost of management giving a better ROI.
•	CFO is the key for strategic projects and we need his blessing early in the cycle.
•	Leverage solution hubs and consulting.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT:
1) Datacenter consolidation from 4 to 1.
2) Estimated savings of $929K/year from using IAAS/PAAS on OCI compared to on-prem.
3) Automated and single consolidated platform for their support and training workloads.
4) Significant saving by selecting OCI to avoid Oracle licensing impact on AWS/Azure.
5) Extremely intuitive customer experience from the custom portal that Oracle Hubs developed for them.
6) 1.5x increase in performance compared to on-prem HW.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Autonomous Datawarehouse and OCI

WINSTORY_NAME: Mary Kay: Oracle Consulting Moves Peoplesoft to OCI
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Mary Kay is focused on “Cloud First” for the future of their business.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Mary Kay had a negative opinion of Oracle. Mary Kay’s VP of IT coined the term, the “new Oracle,” and he communicated that to his executive management that we were a better, friendlier company to do business with.   Total deal ARR: $154K for 3 yrs Consulting: $140K

WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT:
Ultimate cost savings as Mary Kay moves out of their data center and to the Cloud
Improved security in the Cloud

WINSTORY_NAME: SkyWater Technology Foundry: Apex on ATP
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: SkyWater needed to quickly build out a low-code application where their customers can log-in and track orders. SkyWater is developing this application using APEX on ATP.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
1)	Customer was already using ADW + OAC due to a sale earlier in the FY 
2)	Thru discovery sessions we learned about this portal that SkyWater is calling SkyPort 
3)	A SkyWater developer spun up an APEX trial environment in February and was incredibly impressed 
4)	Looped in a member of the Hub team to present an APEX demo 
5)	Worked thru commercials in March and brought on OCS to quote for implementation 
6)	Closed UCC and OCS deal on March 31st
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
1)	APEX is an incredibly powerful tool and competes very well against our competition. SkyWater’s developer who used the APEX trial had been a MSFT developer her entire life. She found the APEX tool much more intuitive than anything she had used before. She even asked us “why the hell have I not heard of APEX before”? 
2)	Building out a portal where our customer’s customers can log-in and view orders is a repeatable use-case not only in manufacturing but any B2B or B2C customer that doesn’t have self-service tracking for their customer base
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Being able to quickly go to market with a secure and scalable application.
WINSTORY_USECASE: APex on ATP

WINSTORY_NAME: Partners HealthCare Gets a Healthy Dose of Efficiency with Move to ExaC@C by NAC Consulting
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Dyke.Morrisey@oralce.com, Michael.Levin@oralce.com, Ross.Emerton@oralce.com, Sanjai.Bhargava@oralce.com, Chris.Girard@oralce.com, Bikash.Bhattacharyya@oralce.com, Vishadithya.Gollerkeri@oralce.com, Jim.Chan@oralce.com, Terrance.Leak@oralce.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: The largest health system in the state serving 1.5M patients, Partners is in the midst of a three-year plan to cut costs, which includes moving out of the data center business and into a more flexible, faster, and cost-effective Cloud model.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Cloud Platform Rep, Dyke Morrissey, started meeting with Partners in January 2019. He quickly determined that the customer could significantly reduce costs while improving security and privacy requirements by moving to Exadata Cloud@Customer. The current Partners’ Exadata team was resistant to change. Dyke persisted. He coordinated behind the scenes with various Oracle teams to present a compelling and holistic One Oracle solution that would specifically address Partners' business challenges. Negotiations continued through the summer. NAC Consulting Sales Rep, Chris Girard, and Cloud Migration experts, Ross Emerton and Sanjai Bhargava, were included in informational sessions set up by Dyke. During these meetings, the technology and business requirements were identified across three LOBs: Enterprise, Finance, and Research
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Collaboration, patience, and teamwork generated a win for $1.6M in ARR and $420K in services. Partners HealthCare has set an aggressive timeframe of six months to migrate to their robust, flexible platform establishing better performance in the Oracle Cloud.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Partners has an extremely complex environment with an amalgamation of many technologies and providers across multiple healthcare entities. They needed a way to streamline their environment, reduce complexity/redundancy, and drive efficiencies across their entire healthcare network
WINSTORY_USECASE: Move and consolidate 182 databases to ExaC@C

WINSTORY_NAME: McDonalds: OIC with ATP for Data Staging
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: McDonalds needed to be able to integrate their HCM Application (Oracle SaaS) with their IBM Tririga application (facilities and space management application).
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
1)	Initial Discovery Call with Customer and the partner (Cognizant)
2)	Technical Discovery to better understand the architecture and desired architecture
3)	Presented solution with pricing (highlighted benefits of cloud and running ATP)
4)	Follow up to solution presentation with updates and adjustments to best fit their needs
5)	Customer committed to project and OIC
6)	Sourcing conversations
7)	Legal negotiations
8)	Customer signature
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
The biggest lesson learned from the sales cycle is managing expectations and goals of everyone involved in the sales process. 

The  communication between our internal sales team was key to the success for this deal. We were constantly texting, calling, and emailing to stay on top of this opportunity and push for a Q3 close date. We also did a great job of getting buy-in from the customer and having an internal champion that could help fight for us when the customer's processes hit roadblocks. We did this by understanding the goals of the project they were starting and quickly responding to any requests and concerns that came up.
Sales team should make sure to get internal Oracle resources aligned as early as possible from a Deal Management perspective.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: McDonald's was working on going live with their Tririga application in December of 2020. They are currently building out the integrations which are a necessary step to ensuring they are on track for an on-time launch of their Tririga application.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Build & Extend Apps with PaaS & IaaS,  Integration Apps & Data, Autonomous Transaction Processing

WINSTORY_NAME: Depository Trust: Autonomous and Analytics
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Middle and Back office did not have the staff to manage the infrastructure supporting an Analytics platform and require autonomous.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Worked with Director of Finance to help deploy and master the technology, then met with lines of business (10 separate discussions) to discuss the success and benefits of their current deployment. The director provided education sessions and demo’s to these lines of business and to ask to include their data sources to the data warehouse and to utilize the Analytics platform. The CSM and Hubsters helped with education, integration requests and troubleshooting to ensure customers success.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Continue to spend more time with customer to grow exiting relationships and build new relationships.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Customer began innovating faster then the technology team with Analytics and then starting building APEX applications use ATP and increased time to market for applications 10X.

WINSTORY_NAME: Amgen: Exa Cloud@Customer
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
On-Premise Requirement
Performance
Business Requirement to move workloads to the Cloud
Upgrade current Exadata platforms
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: This opportunity happened quickly. The initial discussions started in November 2019, we presented the overall solution to the customer on January 8th, 2020, and customer purchased on Feb 28th . Amgen was interested in consolidation of database technologies onto a high performance platform. They had old Exadata’s and were going to refresh, and we showed them a path to an on-premise cloud solution that allowed them to create savings, increase performance and scale as required.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
If you can, do the CSA or Full MSA as early in the sales process as you can.  Amgen would not even start the discussions until they fully agreed to moving forward, which was on Friday, Feb 14, 2020.  The Complex deal team, Tier 1 and Legal were able to respond to redline MSA with Schedule C, S and P over the weekend of Feb 22nd .  Legal and Amgen Legal completed the full negotiation with Amgen in 5 days.   It was awesome to see!
Keep moving things forward, there will always be obstacle.  However, Oracle wants to do business with customers, and we will figure out a way to find a way to have both Oracle and the customer win.    Always lots of pressure coming from lots of places, just keep the customer and Oracle moving forward.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT:
Consolidation of Technology Workloads on Exadata
Performance Increase
No refresh of Exadata on Premise
Cost Savings from consolidation:   Operational Efficiency
WINSTORY_USECASE: Engineered System Consolidation

WINSTORY_NAME: Trueblue: Oracle Analytics for Fusion ERP
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: TrueBlue is a staffing company, which is a historically low-margin industry. They had recently migrated to Oracle Fusion ERP SaaS and needed a financial reporting system that connects seamlessly to Fusion ERP, does not require customization, and is cost-effective to maintain.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The customer had previously used PowerBI and Snowflake, but since migrating to Oracle Fusion ERP, they started looking for a more streamlined analytics and reporting option that would require fewer resources to maintain.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Find the executive sponsor in the line of business early in the sales cycle and take the time to really educate them on the TCO and business value. That individual will be your champion.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT:
Oracle Analytics for Fusion ERP delivered all the pre-built components the customer needs:

WINSTORY_NAME: Andrew Peller: OAC/ADW Specifically for Financial Analytics
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Shane.Stodghill@oracle.com, John.Whitchurch@oracle.com, Ralph Balila@oracle.com, Charles.Barton@oracle.com, Garry.Brenner@oracle.com, Paras.Bhanse@oracle.com, Rohan.Lobo@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
APL wanted to eliminate costly ($350K with Rackspace) infrastructure, software and support for their ERP and BI platforms so they can transform their IT department into data specialists that focus instead on business innovation. The first phase of this transformation was to migrate from Oracle EBS to Oracle ERP Cloud and move their OBIA/OBIEE infrastructure to OCI. The second phase is to start building an analytics platform for their Oracle ERP Cloud and other data sources.
Both phases had to be done very quickly so out-of-the box capabilities was key!
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
Rep/ECA leveraged OCS (already at the customer) to quickly understand current state and identify gaps and challenges.
With the help of Cloud Platform SC, OAX PM and OCS we put together a future state with implementation roadmap and this was presented to the customer.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Showcase the out of the box capabilities in OAX. If additional customization is needed, expand using the standard OAC/ADW platform for extensions.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: The customer had previously used Tableau with a SQL Server Data Warehouse. We positioned OAX plus OAC/ADW specifically for financial analytics, which was clearly a superior solution given the pre-built capabilities.
WINSTORY_USECASE: OAC/ADW Specifically for Financial Analytics

WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
Oracle Cloud Sales, Consulting, and Product Management regrouped with the client and created an action plan focused on business outcomes and helping Personify realize value on the Oracle Cloud faster. SMB Cloud Platform Rep, Leo Meireles, resized the deal and helped put key resources in place. NAC Consulting BI Delivery expert, Gary Brenner, pressed the client for fixed specifications and wrote 250 billing rules to represent the complex, volume discounting that is the foundation of Personify's business model. NAC Consulting implemented ATP, Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC), Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC), and APEX on ATP.
What l

Time to bill largest customer went from 5 days to less than 5 minutes
Departmental Data Entry went from hours to seconds
Departmental Data Entry went from weeks to seconds

Integration Apps & Data, Autonomous Transaction Processing 
And Data Analytics for Business & IT

WINSTORY_NAME: Johnson & Johnson (J&J): Replaces Tableau by automating their reporting with OAC
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Kayla.Mathwig@oracle.com, Ryan.Lanzalott@oracle.com, Adam.Gray@oracle.com, Doug.Palmer@oracle.com, Bob.Horowitz@oracle.com, Yash.Lamba@oracle.com, Maharshi.Desai@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: All the reporting for J&J HR was being done manually. They wanted to be able to replace Tableau and generate an automated daily report.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The Oralce apps team brought in Kayla (Analytics) when the customer expressed frustration with manual reporting. They wanted to be able to automate on a schedule but also in real-time. A session was scheduled with J&J HR team and Oracle sales + tech resources to show a demo of OAC and scope the project. A final, follow up was scheduled for 2 weeks later to discuss implementation steps and timeline. The deal was signed 1 week later. Since then, we have been working closely with them to provision and start using the Analytics software.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Addressing the customer’s immediate and primary need is crucial. J&J’s primary goal was to be able to automate reporting and replace Tableau.  Once we showed that we would be able to do that, they were sold.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Johnson & Johnson has been able to eliminate Tableau in the HR space. They have been able to automate their reports.  Additionally, they are exploring the possibilities of using predictive analytics for their hiring process and employee retention.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Data Analytics for Business IT - OAC

WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q1: The National Bank of Canada quickly saw in their analysis that it would be cheaper, faster and easier to support a migration of their 80 Dbs to ExaCC Gen2 instead of PostgresQL.
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q2: The importance of Simplifying IT, Streamlining access to Data, OPEX savings in IT, Insourcing Data services, Pipelining access to databases were all important to the Bank. The customer was looking to migrate 80 Oracle DB’s to Open Source PostgresQL. It was thought that it would be cheaper than to migrate these DB to Oracle Cloud.
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q3: This customer acquired some ExaCC in 2018 (Gen1) and went through a very long and painful activation process and a lot of issues with the services after activation. In October 2019, customer made it clear to Oracle that if these issues were not addressed they would go away from ExaCC to another solution.  Many teams at Oracle were involved to help reestablish the relationship and a reliable service. OCS was involved in the migration of DB to ExaCC Gen1 from 2019 and kept their dedication to make this a success all through the difficult time. OCS, led by Aaron Millstone and Frank Crusing was also involved in the new services offering that was part of the deal and  by offering the customer an assessment of the project and program to see how we could jointly accelerate the migration of more than a hundred DB to the ExaCC (Gen1 and Gen2).
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q4:
1. Ensuring the message back to the customer was aligned with the objectives
2. Leveraging the execs around you at Oracle can help you ensure the proper narrative even if all they do is repeat exactly what you have been saying
3. You cannot over communicate on a new complex solution, through repeated sessions and workshops 
4. Ensure everyone understands the narrative (at Oracle and at the customer) this will make sure the contracts and legal happy on both sides
5. Complex deals like this do not end with the order booking, a lot of effort are required right after booking to ensure we get back to the business objectives (now that legal is addressed) and the sales rep leadership is even more required at this stage

WINSTORY_USECASE: Backup E-Business Suite and Exadata to the cloud
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q1: Uber needed a cost-effective way to backup E-Business Suite to the cloud.  In addition, they wanted to offload non-prod workloads from on-premises Exadatas to free up resources.  Uber also needed a low cost solution for archiving pre-IPO data for regulatory compliance.
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q2: Cost savings, most effective use of expensive on-prem Exadatas and regulatory compliance for pre-IPO data.
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q3: Uber initially asked how they could backup Oracle apps and databases to AWS.  The sales team used that as a way to challenge the customer to investigate a solution on Oracle Cloud.  Regular education sessions and discussions enabled Uber to learn about the price/performance and functionality advantages Oracle offers.
WINSTORY_CONSULTING_Q4: We can win against Amazon.  Our price/performance value proposition is compelling.  Hybrid deals that involve cloud, on-prem, OCS, Oracle University and ACS provide competitive differentiation.  Backup, DR and archive is a “trojan horse” which allows us to get our foot in the door and expand.  We’re now talking with Uber about an full blown EBS move and improve.

WINSTORY_NAME: Sonoco: OAC Improves performance and reliability of EBS in OCI
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Sonoco needs to improve the performance and reliability of the of their global EBS footprint. Eventually, customer will move to SaaS ERP.  The decision was made to invest in OCI versus procure new hardware or move workloads to Azure.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Collaboration is key.  This was a multi Oracle sales pillar deal that included our Apps and Oracle Consulting counterparts.  The CIO views Oracle as one team and looked at the multiple solutions from each sales pillar as one solution.  The internal collaboration and consistent messaging to the Sonoco was critical to the success for the three sales teams involved.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: The Oracle executive teams were engaged with the CIO early in the sales cycle.  This sponsorship was beneficial to driving the opportunities forward and gaining and understanding from the CIO’s perspective what was required from Oracle to get the deals done.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: We are still in the implementation phase but the customer’s desire is to improve performance and reliability of EBS (global manufacturing plants run 24 x 7 decreasing downtime is critical), utilize OAC to gain business insights and better respond to the needs of the business.  Moving to OCI also has allowed the customer to create a true disaster recovery environment.

WINSTORY_NAME: Western Union FY20Q3: Transfroms their business using ADW and OAC
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Western Union Business Group (WUBG) has built a a custom financial trading application on force.com which is used by internal business customers for managing financial portfolio data. The customer was in need of an analytics solution with robust self-service data visualization capabilities to embed within the custom application. They selected to use OAC for Reporting and DV and ADW as the data repository for OAC. Drivers of their decision was providing better performance to business users, and having one unified system from a single vendor. The Oracle sales team (CPR, Analytics Specialist, ECA) has convinced WU to use ADW as the repository for OAC over company DW Snowflake.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The Oracle CPR, Analytics Specialist and CSM worked with the customer on current under utilization of UCCs monthly commit which was coming up for renewal in few months. Western Union had just announced 10% cut in staff workforce. The  Oracle team discussed the expected benefits of OAC and ADW and what Western Union could be doing to get greater value from their current 300k investment. The discussion then expanded and led to the identification of a new use-case with WUBG and their Financial Trading app project. Oracle had to prove our solution would work and meet WUBG user expectations which required the technical team to demonstrate the solution in WUBG's custom built app and overcome technical challenges with integration and authentication.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Engage with the customer early and often with a point of view on how our solutions can deliver value and help them be very successful. As a CPR Deal would not have happened without a coordinated focused sales effort of my account resource team- Analytics Specialist, Technical Specialist and CSM,
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT:
Western Unon is rolling out  an app embedded with OAC and ADW as data source in late April to 800 internal users. 

The Impact:
1) Enabled Western Union end users with self-service cloud-based analytics solution
2) Better performance for business
3) WUBG having one unified system to manage from a single vendor
WINSTORY_USECASE: Autonomous Data Warehouse / Data Analytics for Business & IT

WINSTORY_NAME: HNI: Choses Scalability with Oracle Cloud, ExaCS
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: HNI is the second largest office furniture manufacturer in the world and does 70% of their manufacturing in Muscatine, Iowa.   HNI runs manufacturing 24x7, they cannot take outages and has to perform optimally at all times. Following a go-live the business incurred business disruption from outages and poor performance.  HNI thought their hosting provider was not providing. HNI could not load test and believed a POC would not meet their needs strong expertise and architecture guidance.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: We positioned ExaCS due to HNI RAC configuration and performance needs.  We stressed the performance increases of Exadata compared to their current commodity environment.  We also stressed the UCC model and ability to move OCPU’s around as needed to give HNI maximum flexibility.  We provided manufacturing reference calls with Doosan and Darling, and leveraged OCS for migration services to be full Oracle on Oracle by Oracle solution.  We positioned Oracle cloud support and the Tier 1 response time.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Teamwork is critical.  Initially, the CIO mandated the production environment be on-premise but the account team and supporting OCI team was able to show the power of the cloud and utilizing FastConnect.  Leveraging the cloud support structure and a 15 minute response on Tier 1 SR’s and bringing in the support team to walk through real scenarios and how Oracle addresses them.  Re-emphasizing Oracle’s roles and responsibilities and customer teamwork approach
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: HNI can now easily scale and create new environments to support their changing business needs.  They do not have to invest/manage hardware infrastructure which keeps their team more nimble.
WINSTORY_USECASE:
Move Apps and DB Workloads to Cloud
ExaCS

WINSTORY_NAME: Wind River: OBIEE to OAC & ADW
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Wind River wanted get out from underneath their OBIEE annual support renewal that they see a 2-3% uplift on each year.  Wind River’s CIO also wanted to improve employee productivity by freeing their only Oracle DBA from maintenance and patching work.  Their upcoming renewal presented a compelling event that enabled our team to speak on the advantages of Cloud.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The deal began strictly as an economics play – with the goal being to architect a proposal that would allow Wind River to reduce their annual analytics bill.  However, understanding that customer has made a significant investment in Looker and Snowflake, our team re-focused the discussion on the value that OAC & ADW will bring to their organization.  Over time, we helped make it clear to Wind River that OAC will be the best tool for them (not only better than OBIEE, but also Looker). There are modernizations, updates and features, etc. that, after their users begin to use, will result in wide adoption across theirs organization.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: We intend to use the above win as a proof point to demonstrate the value of Oracle Cloud to Wind River.  Additional phases of Wind River’s journey to the cloud includes; moving their custom applications to OCI, as well as lifting and shifting their EBS environment.  It is also our team’s goal to compete and take out Snowflake as their enterprise data warehouse.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Wind River committed to $143k ARR for 1 year (ADW & OAC) plus 1 ADW Rapid Start bundle. They’re moving from OBIEE to OAC (and adopted ADW for usage and performance tracking). This is Wind River’s first Oracle Cloud purchase.
WINSTORY_USECASE: OBIEE to OAC & ADW – for usage and performance tracking

WINSTORY_NAME: HomeAdvisor: OAC Renovates Analytics - OBIEE to OAC
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: it wasn’t a question of ‘if’ they’d move to the cloud, but a question of ‘when’ and which company would take them there.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: James Molloy, Oracle Analytics Solution Specialist, the  laid the groundwork for an expansion of the relationship. He educated their team on Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) and guided them through a trial, where among other things the HomeAdvisor team learned that migrating to OAC from OBIEE gave them access to OAC’s visualization tool. James conducted the entire deal remotely, heavily leveraging Zoom. Jim Burns, Oracle Enterprise Cloud Platform Specialist, worked on the account from a sales perspective, building a solid relationship with HomeAdvisor’s VP and ensuring a pricing structure that worked for both sides
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: “There were some bugs in the system that delayed the launch,” James said. “We reached out to the CEAL team, who worked hand-in-hand with Mark Smith and the HUB out of Boston.” The combined team handled service requests, educated the customer on the OAC visualization tool, walked them through security and finished up the deployment process.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: HomeAdvisor responded to the visualization tool’s ability to increase the accessibility of their data throughout the business, it would also give them a better way to monitor their website and make Tableau redundant.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Data Analytics for Business & IT

WINSTORY_NAME: Viscosity North America: Build & Extend Apps with PaaS & IaaS #OracleInAction
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT:
To help limit potential exposure to COVID-19, Scott Spendolini, VP at Viscosity NA, created a community knowledge-sharing app aimed at reducing the number of outings an individual has to make to find high-demand household items.  
DailyGroceryStatus.com, built using APEX on Oracle Cloud Free Tier, allows people to search for commonly needed items (produce, meat, eggs and even toilet paper) across local stores. The results are displayed on a map so users can choose between the closest or best-stocked stores. Community members can add cities and submit their own status updates, ensuring that the data remains accurate.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Build & Extend Apps with PaaS & IaaS

WINSTORY_NAME: Sherwin Williams: OIC, ATP, ADW
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: They were using credits for OIC and ADW/ATP, as well as 4 instances of OIC to connect all third party and Oracle SaaS Applications. WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Sherwin Williams expanded their existing cloud environment to prevent further overage charges and test ADB to serve as the data source under OIC. Additionally, they want to do an early renewal for another 36 month term - having the environment expire in December 2023 rather than December 2021. This way we can offer a higher rate card discount.  We managed to secure a 20% discount for expansion of their 21-month existing contract.
