WINSTORY_NAME: Capgemini: OCI for training & internal POCs
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Stephen.Mayer@oracle.com, Joe Winston.@oracle.com, Kevin.Cantoli@oracle.com, Giuseppe.Lino@oracle.com, Brian.Bennett@oracle.com
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: We are combining their tenancies, migrating lagging services from Gen 1 to Gen 2, and actively putting on workshops to increase consumption and ensure that they are up to date on the latest Oracle technologies. We executed an expansion of their contract to the next discount threshold to give them access to more services. They are currently using almost every PaaS/IaaS service, including App Dev, ATP, Integration, Compute, and Block Chain. Next steps include completing the migration of Gen 1 to Gen 2, increasing consumption of services through education and hand holding, and consolidating contracts to keep everything on the same lifecycle for easier account management and transparency for the customer. We will use these engagements with the customer to promote adoption of Oracle Cloud vs other cloud vendors they are also partners with.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: The customer is an Oracle Partner that has quite a few disparate tenancies on Gen 1 and Gen 2 Oracle cloud that were set up either by services not being available in Gen 2, different needs for client engagements, acquisitions, etc. This resulted in: overlapping contracts, seemingly redundant tenancies, little understanding of which services were connected or active, and confusion about which contact to engage with. We needed to create an account strategy to support them and make their contracts and tenancies much more transparent before focusing on a consumption plan. We used the Cloud Consumption dashboard to identify that their contract was coming to an end, and spoke with them about upcoming projects and combining their tenancies. Most of the analysis was contractual as they are well versed in Oracle and able to implement themselves. We held weekly meetings with Solution teams, development in India, and CSMs. The PMO team supported with migration from Gen 1 to Gen 2.
WINSTORY_USECASE: OCI for training & internal POCs. They are currently using almost every PaaS/IaaS service, including App Dev, ATP, Integration, Compute, and Block Chain.

WINSTORY_NAME: Bank of New York Mellon: ATP / Integration Apps & Data
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Bank of New York Mellon needed a cloud database underneath the ERP cloud to perform data integrations between ERP and other third-party applications they owned. They eventually wanted to do integrations with their ERP and other applications and extend the applications’ analytics capabilities down the line, potentially with OAC in the future. They were considering Database as a Service to host the ERP cloud. We presented the two cloud database options, Database as an Option and Autonomous Transaction Processing to our internal champion. The company liked the fully managed backend aspect of ATP and the ability for their IT teams to focus on more important tasks the company needed from its employees, especially during the COVID-19 crisis.  They ultimately selected Autonomous Transaction Processing due to lower price, TCO, and the Oracle-managed backend.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The customer committed to a $60K annual commit for one year. This deal was the first Autonomous deal with Bank of New York Mellon, and we will use this to strategically increase Autonomous usage within the finance and other LOBs. We are starting workshops to increase Autonomous usage. Additionally, this is a pre-cursor to an OAC opportunity, as a goal for the customer is to extend their analytics capabilities from their ERP, so we will start having OAC conversations. The ultimate goal here is Exadata cloud at customer, and then have them continue using Autonomous.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Finance LOB bought ERP Cloud in November and had a requirement for a cloud database underneath the ERP. They were always considering Oracle as Oracle runs best on Oracle and their two options were Database as a Service and Autonomous Transaction Processing.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Using ATP as a platform to connect ERP to other third party applications

WINSTORY_NAME: Bolthouse Farms: Oracle Analytics Cloud with EssbaseCS/ATP
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
Bolthouse has a strategic initiative to leverage more robust, enhanced analytics beginning with their financial reporting and automate this process.
Bolthouse anticipates expanding use cases to Sales, Marketing and Supply Chain Management analytics.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The Oracle Team created a strong relationship with John Monczewski- VP Analytics, who championed this project. He pulled in the  VP IT-David Reed and Peloton as the partner. We all worked in lockstep to move this forward quickly and with consistent messaging. We leveraged all existing relationships, showed an easy solution that was scalable, economical and automated.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: We learned that phasing the project over a number of months was key. We lowered the monthly commit for the first 3 months and then tacked on a a heavier commit on the last 3 months of the term. This way we were able to stretch their current budget, gain a longer term contract and offer a better discount.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Scalability, flexiblity of collaboration, Pay for what you use, and introducing the cloud platform as a spring board to other Cloud transformation projects within Bolthouse.
WINSTORY_USECASE:
Oracle Analytics Cloud with EssbaseCS/ATP will be the solution for 
the initial use case of Financial Planning, Analysis and Reporting.

WINSTORY_NAME: Vanguard: IDCS, OIC, ADW
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Vanguard(VG) started an evaluation with Deloitte(Design) & Oracle in June 2019 to explore moving from Peoplesoft to Oracle ERP/EPM Cloud. VG has a number of vendors across the ERP footprint.  This includes WD for HR, Zucius for Procurement and PS for Financials. This creates a burden for IT to maintain all the integration points.  There has been significant turnover at VG so there is limited in-house knowledge for the PS platform. VG will need to invest heavily in PS over the next 18 months to manage the PUM process as well as additional integrations.  In 2018 Vanguard contracted PCMCS which is the first Oracle Cloud application for Vanguard Finance.  The implementation went extremely well and created positive relationships with Vanguard Management
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: In June 2019 a new CPR aligned with Vanguard (VG) and began to unpack and understand the VG business as well as history and presents between both orgs. The Oracle CPR began to drive on direct alignment to relationships at Exec layer(CTO of Cloud) out to the newly formed CG Cloud strategy team led by CTO.  Based on this work the CPR team aligned with the Vanguard Fin group leading the PS to ERP/EPM strategy.  The CPR then reached out to Oracle ASM to align on driving the PaaS side of things to ensure success.  In Sept 2019 VG began a paid for ERP/EPM trial($40K) for three months(extended to 6mo) Because the CPR team had already developed their own VG relationships it was natural to align a PaaS Trail(SE led from Hub) to help with advanced Integration(OIC), migration(ADW) and security(IDCS) requirements of the project. The Trial needed to be extended and the ASM/CPR teams managed for 6 months to basically help build out dev environments while final BOMs and commercials finally came to close in May 2020.  CPR team is now working an OAX opp for Q1 FY21. Shout out to a Strong CSM(Zach Matthews), Hub resources(Mike Terra/David Huffman) & ECA(Brett Lovelidge) as this was the team that held together the technical execution over a 6+mo PaaS DEV/Trial cycle while we finalized the BOM and commercials.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
The Combined team necessary to win PaaS for SaaS(CSM, HUB, ECA, CPR) along with tight alignment with ASM team.
Building your own customer relationship and finding path with ASM team is a must. 
A hub led SE Trial was a great way to manage this experience with VG and at the end we converted to 5yr UCM with potential expansion expected with in the first year because of other use cases now in view.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Vanguard (VG) shared by taking advantage of PaaS for SaaS and how well the ASM and CPR team worked as one unit to VG it will reduce the project timeline by 6mos.  The improved timing will allow them to avoid other contract renewals with the other vendors which delivers on the ROI promised to VG leadership.
WINSTORY_USECASE: IDCS, OIC, ADW

WINSTORY_NAME: Williams Technology: OAC, ADW, Essbase, IDCS
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Lift/Shift Financial Data Warehouse
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
•	Worked with Fusion AE to determine proper person to reach out for Operation Blue Skies  
•	We were then introduced to Huron Technologies, who was the Service Provider to make adjustments with the customer’s future state architecture.  Matt (OAC Overlay), Adam (ECA), Harish (SE for ADW), Fiona, and Chinmay (both HUB SEs)
•	The architecture required the latest version of Essbase, moving the existing on-prem FDW to the cloud and replace with ADW, and also using IDCS for automated synching and bridging.  
•	Once we were able to finalize the BoM with customer and partner, we decided the best way to handle the billing would be co-terming everything with their existing Fusion contract (Matt and Steve).
•	The contract allowed us to add UCC for 2 additional years of OAC, as well as 4 years of the new products
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
1) Teamwork - Leverage anyone within Oracle that has a relationship with customer to make an introduction.  
2) Make sure you understand the role of the Partner - In this case critical. Always look for expansion opportunities.  
3)Understand current customer projects and goals looking to see how Oracle can assist them and make their life easier.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Cost savings through consolidation of applications, and Operational efficiency
WINSTORY_USECASE: Autonomous Data Warehouse

WINSTORY_NAME: Ichor: Universal Cloud Credits: Java Cloud Service, DCBS, Object Storage
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Niwath.Chhun@oracle.com, Charlie.Chen@oracle.com, Suresh.James@oracle.com, Jeff.Lewis@oracle.com, Ashwin.Rakhra@oracle.com, Simon.Holland@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Ichor Systems is going through digital transformation and will be upgrading their ERP system from EBS to Oracle ERP Cloud. They have a targeted go-live date of October and will need to quickly implement custom web forms to process transitions from on-premise MES Applications to ERP Cloud. Oracle SaaS ERP does not provide this functionally out of the box and only OCI can support this app development project.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: This Sales Process was a successful partnership with Apps. In November, we reached out Ichor about a possible Move and Improve, but got notified of an audit for on-premise licenses so we reached out to coordinate a strategy. In the process we found that a new CIO was appointed who wanted to move to a Cloud system. An RFP was issued and the apps team ultimately won the bid. In coordination with the Apps team, we were able to help remove the audit and close a 5 year ERP Cloud contract. Part of the overall proposal was OCI to support ERP implementation in partnership with Infosys. We worked with their team to size, demo and position value and ultimately won as a team.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: A few very interesting things came out of this sales cycle in terms of negotiating with the customer. Ichor selected an evaluation partner Symphony Consulting. They were there from the beginning of the sales cycle and remained the lead negotiators towards the end. Two things they requested were unique request and since they recently closed a contract with Apps, they wanted our ordering document to have some similar terms. They requested a cap on the renewal which we do not do and also clarification on rate card price changes during the term of the order. Working with Tier 1 and John Dolan we were able to add language that meet Ichor requirements.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Ichor will be able to have a completely integrated platform in the Cloud for all enterprise applications, while their MES application remains on-premise. OCI will bridge the gap between ERP Cloud and on-premise and provide Ichor future PaaS services to continue their digital transformation. The project is currently underway and we will capture more success milestones as they are achieved.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Java Cloud, Database Cloud, IDCS, Storage

WINSTORY_NAME: FICO: EBS Lift & Shift to OCI
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: FICO has a Cloud First strategy.  This purchase will enable FICO to put the last remaining on Prem Apps into a cloud environment. This approach has many benefits, including improved decision making, reduction of errors through automation, and ability to better manage risk and optimize assets. FICO's EBS was sitting on old hardware. EBS was the last mission critical application in FICO's data center.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: This sales process involved the help of the entire Oracle pre-sales arsenal. Mark Weber worked directly with the leadership within the customer to develop a future state and BOM. Mark worked continuously to refine the architecture and BOM to the requirements of the customer. The Oracle Cloud Solution Hub team helped to execute a POC running EBS on OCI. The final stage of the sales process was a comparison between AWS, which OCI was the clear winner.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: The entire Oracle pre-sales team worked extensively to prove out running EBS on OCI. The Oracle team ran a 60 day POC environment that helped convince FICO's decision makers OCI was the only way to go. Utilizing the POC effectively, combined with an iron-clad business case, the Oracle team was able to prove the value of the solution while keeping any potential competition out.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Reduced infrastructure cost, the customer’s entire back-office is now deployed in the cloud. FICO now has the ability to increase automation in their back-office solutions, which they were not able to do with their traditional hardware deployment.
WINSTORY_USECASE: EBS Lift & Shift to OCI

WINSTORY_NAME: Florida Blue: Shift Essbase Cubes to OAC
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_NAME: Florida Blue (Blue Cross Blue Shield Florida)
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: With the new partnership between Oracle and Microsoft, the technology Florida Blue was looking for to connect their data centers became available – particularly around Azure AD and Oracle IDCS – which was a critical element their team needed before moving forward. We conducted an SC-led trial to spin up OAC, brought their data into the environment for testing purposes, and connected the instance back into their network to show compatibility. This was the first North America Cloud win leveraging two different data centers as well as the new Oracle partnership with Microsoft Azure. We are continuing to work closely with the team to ensure they are consuming.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Blue Cross Blue Shield Florida (Florida Blue) was an existing Universal Cloud Credits customer, but not consuming. We originally reached out to learn what they were looking to accomplish and what roadblocks they were encountering. We quickly learned they were looking to increase performance, modernize technology, and reduce their data center footprint. They are running on both Oracle and Microsoft data centers.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Shift Essbase cubes to OAC, Connecting Azure AD and Oracle IDCS

WINSTORY_NAME: Steris: Moving DIPC-Governance to EDQ on OCI with ADW
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: We showed them that DIPC would be at minimum $3600 a month with no pausing allowed, while EDQ + ADW would only require a small expansion in order to get license rights. The customer agreed with our approach and moved forward with the purchase. They worked with their partner to implement EDQ.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Steris owned credits for DIPC-Gov, which is a sunsetted service. This influenced our conversations to move to Oracle Enterprise Data Quality (EDQ) on VM and ADW. DIPC-Gov would be far more expensive and clunky to run for their needs at ~ $1800 per instance.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Moving DIPC-Governance to EDQ on OCI with ADW

WINSTORY_NAME: The Washington Post: Lift and shift Oracle Apps to OCI and ADW
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Trevor.Davies@oracle.com, Waleed.Ahmed@oracle.com, John.Keefe@oracle.com, Ryan.Lever@oracle.com, Craig.Guertz@oracle.com, Paul.Weber@oracle.com
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Because of the previous deals (IDCS, Chatbots, and Integrations), Washington Post was already comfortable with Oracle Cloud. However, there were still a few hurdles to overcome, including:  losing the influencer of the first three deals, gaining a new contact and procurement process, and issues with PCI terminology from the security team. With the latter, our ECA Waleed Ahmed did a great job explaining the customer-facing documents and how they were attested by a third party. By moving to the Cloud, the IT department will have easier manageability around patching thanks to ADW, and the Finance LOB will have faster application speeds while using EBS on a day-to-day basis.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Oracle had completed three Cloud deals with The Washington Post in FY20, with the Finance department being the last to move and modernize to the Cloud. This didn’t sit well with the Finance LOB as they were working with aging hardware and knew migrating their EBS apps to OCI would give them the performance they needed.

WINSTORY_NAME: US Venture: Lift & Shift Homegrown App to OCI
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Joey.Bilvaisas@oracle.com, Brian.k.thompson@oracle.com, Robert.Ronan@oracle.com, Tara.VanCleave@oracle.com,Jonathan.Engelhardt@oracle.com, Dan.Carroll@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Through discussions, we were able to understand a clear picture of Ashish’s ideal solution. A solutions diagram was developed that incorporated all the performance, storage, and operational needs that the customer had hoped for, even covering multiple steps of his planned expansion in a single step, which excited Ashish to hear his plan could take off sooner than expected. The solution that was decided on included running the application on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure with Oracle Linux for his three Virtual Machines (Production, Analysis, and Development), Oracle’s Object Storage with a NAS and storage gateway for storing files, and Oracle Autonomous Database as the backend database. Creating a complete Oracle Solution encompassing Oracle Java, Oracle Linux, and Autonomous Database all running on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
Oracle was able to win out because of a few factors: The customer relationship developed through the sales process allowed for a deep understanding and accurate solution provided for Ashish, which he mentioned was the reason he stopped talking with AWS; ADW’s self-patching and self-driving features allowed the customer to move forward without relying on traditional database management and its inherent costs; Oracle’s low cost for storage; and lastly, Oracle’s ability to provide a complete solution provided value to the customer above the value of an on-premise solution or their previous cloud vendors of choice. 
Next Steps
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Ashish Pant is a Quantitative Trader for US Oil (a division of US Venture) and developed a homegrown application on on-premise technology to ingest market data from two different data providers to produce reports to guide US Oil’s Market Investments. The plan was to expand the application and build a department around it, but the application had no disaster recovery, backup, or ability to scale. Ashish was searching for a way to meet the needs of the company President and Head of IT, who suggested he move the application to Azure to align with their company’s overall direction (they made a commitment to move 70-80% of their data centers to Azure). Ashish met with both Azure & AWS but was unhappy with their ability to understand and meet his needs. At this point, Ashish was found by the Inbound BDC Team and the LAND team commenced discussions.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Lift & Shift homegrown application on to OCI. ADW for consolidating data sources for reporting.

WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: CC Industries was having difficulty integrating their HR applications (ADP and HCM) and wanted better payroll reporting capabilities.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: While we fixed their initial issue of data integration and moving their applications to OCI, we were able to get CC Industries to commit to testing out ADW in this deal prior to their investment in OAC. Our competition was Mulesoft. Right after the deal closed, we engaged our team’s hubster, Sara Lipowski, who is currently assisting with the implementation and we are following up in the months to come with conversations surrounding OAC usage for payroll reporting.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: With our positive relationship with Grant Thornton (their customer advisor), we were able to work with CC Industries to provide them a solution to put their HR payroll applications on OCI. WINSTORY_NAME: BrightSpring Health Services: OIC & ADW
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: BrightSpring needed consistent and integrated data for proper analysis and application development. The customer did not specify any business requirements other than limiting the number of vendors they purchase from (as to not complicate things) and to find the most affordable solution for the value it provides.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: One of the two environments they had was Oracle, so the customer decided that it made the most sense to integrate using Oracle Integration. They are using OIC for integration and ADW to begin their data warehousing footprint. There were not any roadblocks during the deal cycle, though the purchasing part of the cycle was delayed due to multiple internal levels of approval on the customer’s end. We are working with BrightSpring to expand ADW usage for future expansion deals. The customer also has a subsidiary that plans to leverage the “Always Free” tier of the cloud to plan for projects down the road
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: The customer had two separate (and different) environments after the merger between PharMerica and ResCare, now officially BrightSpring. After speaking with their Director of Application Development, it was apparent that the merger had created many issues on the IT end because of the differences between the two environments. They decided to begin by integrating the data so they can quickly maintain business as usual, and then phase into data warehousing so that they could sit their third party applications on top and reduce maintenance by leveraging AI.
WINSTORY_USECASE: OIC for integration and ADW to begin their data warehousing footprint after merger

WINSTORY_NAME: Xoom: DYN DNS to OCI & Autonomous
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: PayPal parent company had already underwent a similar DYN to OCI migration.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: We proceeded to size out the OCI environment and determine all functions and capabilities needed. An additional need for Autonomous Database was discovered. Xoom purchased $12K monthly flex for a 2-year term. First step is converting all legacy DYN domains to OCI. Second step, identify additional use-cases for ADW with extra UCCs

WINSTORY_NAME: Aisin: OIC to move on-premise database to Autonomous Database
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: OIC was determined to be the best Analytics solution for Aisin’s priority project. Further discovery uncovered the need for additional system management support for the customer as a direct result of COVID-19, and Autonomous Database was established as the best fit to begin relieving this issue. They renewed their Analytics and added OIC on Monthly Flex UCC. This established the customer’s first Oracle Gen 2 Cloud environment, which they will use to expand into Autonomous in their next phase of implementation.  Customer renewed $22k of Analytics and committed $14.4k ARR on UCC allowing them to integrate their initial projects with Oracle Gen2 Cloud and set the foundations for moving applications into Autonomous Database. Customer will begin their OIC integration. The Oracle team is currently working with the customer to overcome their new budgeting complications with the COVID crisis, which, once resolved, will open additional UCC for the Autonomous Database phase of their project.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: The Oracle Systems Manager at Aisin Holdings of America’s priority project was to create integration between their application and their Oracle non-UCC Analytics. Due to COVID-19, the customer is currently the only staffed systems manager for all of the Oracle databases at the company, and any solution that could relieve the stress of maintaining these systems by himself would prove extremely valuable.
WINSTORY_USECASE: OIC to move on-premise database to Autonomous Database

WINSTORY_NAME: Enbridge: ADW & OAC for BI team
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Gaynor.Houghton@oracle.com, Jack.Fuson@oracle.com, Vikram.Singh.Walia@oracle.com, Dmitry.Khait@oracle.com, Chip.Baber@oracle.com, John.Givens@oracle.com, James.Pratt@oracle.com, Cleve.phol@oracle.com
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Gaynor (LAND) reached out to the contact overseeing the already existing Cloud environment for testing purposes and brought him different use cases to consider. During that conversation, the customer thought it would be best to bring on his technical counterpart who was actually testing out ADW/OAC for the BI Team under the Unify project and was able to give more insight into how to expand this to the other departments.  The customer is currently implementing ADW for the BI team and expanding to other departments through testing. Enbridge is working to better understand how to utilize the Cloud environment and give access to those beyond the initial team by working with Accenture to further map out their UCC’s. This deal is a 6 year deal and will provide an environment for Enbridge to host many projects in, such as moving 32 data centers to the Cloud, as well as combining their ERP system. The ultimate goal is to move the company as a whole to the Cloud, so there will be more opportunities to expand beyond the Unify Project.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Enbridge is consolidating Union Gas and Enbridge Gas Distribution (EGD), and is combining their ERP systems under the Unify Project in the Cloud. The current BI team under the Unify project is using OAC, but sitting on top of DBaaS, and they want use ADW to house info and source to EPM information and create dashboards. Their biggest challenge is having to go from source to source to gather information or having to wait on other teams to give them their data, causing back-up. They would like to streamline their processes.
WINSTORY_USECASE: ADW & OAC for BI team

WINSTORY_NAME: Zoom: Zoom activates millions of concurrent meetings on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Zoom needed cloud provider to reduce OpEx, and scale capacity for 300 million daily participants
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
A head engineer at Zoom left a voicemail for Oracle on a Sunday afternoon asking for help standing up a service. This was before a strategic deal had been reached. The Oracle team didn’t want to wait until Monday and worked for 12 hours that day. Within 2 days, millions of zoom customers were relying on Oracle.
Overnight, Zoom became an essential tool for the global workforce because of COVID-19. The number of Zoom’s customers exploded by 30 times from their December figures, all the way up to 300M users. The strain on Zoom’s private cloud combined with issues with their public cloud providers
Zoom wasn’t a legacy database customer, proving that Oracle Cloud Infrastructure is good for enterprise-grade, internet-scale operations and has the pipeline to bring other large customers on.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Two important takeaways to share about the zoom deal are 1) the focus was on how we make the customer successful, not on how do we sell them and 2) the engineering complexities involved many layers but was solved as one problem where everyone one worked towards one goal.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: OCI’s price performance advantage and pledge to provide white glove service sealed Zoom’s commitment to migrate
WINSTORY_USECASE: Zoom activates millions of concurrent meetings on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure

WINSTORY_NAME: The Villages: Utilizing OAX to gain fast access to information to improve time to value
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: The Holding Company of the Villages is one of the fastest growing commercial real estate/community living organizations in Florida. They had concerns with disparate financial reporting systems as they grow in size. They needed fast KPI’s, pre-packaged & built in content to speed up time to value for analytics
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
- Very large SaaS Fusion ERPM install base with existing UCC with OAC. 
- Demo of OAX at OOW, immediately saw the value to business users. 
- Began a POC to start exploring led to a net new 24 month deal
- Roadmap fits SaaS deployment plan, made both short & long term sense.
- Integrate with outside data sources
Pre-built reporting accelerated insights from their financial data.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Must have strong collaboration throughout the entire sales discovery & close process.
Technical, sales, product, solution specialis etc.
POC’s/Demo’s/Trials should be done early on in the sales cycle with the LOB application users.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: The pre-packaged financial analytics data model and content that comes with OAX is extremely helpful for the business, for their financial reporting process which is what they will first be utilizing the solution for.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Utilizing OAX to gain fast access to information to improve time to value across the organization

WINSTORY_NAME: OUTFRONT Media: ADW & OAC Expansion
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: As small overages became a monthly expense, the Oracle account team leveraged the overages to create demand for expansion.The customer committed to a $8,519 expansion, but was originally heading towards a much larger expansion than what was closed here. The issue of budgetary constraints arose when COVID-19 caused a revenue issue, and we settled on a smaller expansion to eliminate overages in the short term. We plan to revisit additional usage as OUTFRONT continues roll out and business picks back up. We’ll also focus on how to use additional features of OAC for additional expansion dollars prior to their renewal date in Dec. 2020.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: OUTFRONT Media’s current environment included both ADW and OAC with a monthly commit of $20K ($240 ARR). They were consistently exceeding their monthly subscription for ADW/OAC due to their Analytics and Data Management team rolling out new initiatives with Spatial Studio, Graph, and OML.
WINSTORY_USECASE: ADW/OAC for Spatial Studio, Graph, and OML initiatives

WINSTORY_NAME: DISH Network: OCI, Integrate HCM SaaS with On premise EBS
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Dish started a PayGo environment June 2019 using ICS to connect their HCM SaaS to EBS. The IT team running the project liked what they were seeing in the PayGo and wanted to begin expanding this initiative. With the added savings of moving to Monthly Flex, they can begin expanding the environment and show its success to other areas of the business. DISH currently uses TIBCO integration in other areas of the business. The IT team plans to use the success of this environment to show other teams why Oracle is a better solution.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: DISH Network operates a national in-home installation workforce, as well as an advertising sales group delivering targeted advertising solutions on DISH TV and Sling TV. In addition to its TV services, DISH has commenced buildout of a national narrowband "Internet of Things" network to provide innovative connectivity solutions and applications through its strategic spectrum portfolio. They needed to Integrate their Oracle HCM SaaS with their On premise EBS.
WINSTORY_USECASE: OCI; Integrate HCM SaaS with On premise EBS

WINSTORY_NAME: Zimmer Inc: OIC & ATP with Rapid Start bundle
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: We found out how many endpoints and ‘messages’ would be flowing through OIC to properly size the Universal Cloud Credits, and quickly put together an ATP Monthly Flex deal to support a fast go-live. We attached the NAC Consulting Rapid Start Bundle to ensure their success. The customer was able to begin architecting their integration maps, speeding up their go-live time for Oracle ERP. Zimmer will continue to use OIC as they move more systems to the Cloud.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: After finding a gap with their recent SaaS deal, Zimmer needed help moving their ERP from on-prem to the cloud. They had no way to easily connect their ERP SaaS to the rest of their IT environment that wouldn’t be extremely costly to do on their own or with a partner.
WINSTORY_USECASE: OIC & ATP with Rapid Start bundle to connect Oracle ERP SaaS with on-prem apps

WINSTORY_NAME: Healthfirst: Build & Extend Apps with PaaS & IaaS, ADW
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: This was the first Cloud purchase for Healthfirst – they already had PeopleSoft and an on-prem database. We brought in Mythics to help Healthfirst build and implement a customized solution to be able to create notifications and be an end-to-end monitoring system for them. Healthfirst is using Oracle Management Cloud (OMC) and Autonomous Database as a repository for log data and a sandbox for database testing. They have plans to eventually move workloads to Autonomous to avoid a lag in database patching and upgrading. Mythics has helped Healthfirst in managing this environment and they plan to grow it over time.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: The customer was discovering anomalies across their Peoplesoft HR environment and had issues identifying the root cause. It led to a lot of internal battles, a struggle to get other tasks accomplished, and issues around database versioning and who was responsible. Their IT team was under a lot of scrutiny as they were having problems identifying why systems were slow and how the database upgrade process was affecting performance and security.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Build & Extend Apps with PaaS & IaaS, ADW

WINSTORY_NAME: Duraflame: Fusion Analytics for ERP
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
- Hard to pull reports for “AR Deduction Settlement”
- Limitations of OTBI within Fusion Financials
- Lack of trust in Oracle “always a catch”.  IT Director asked team to stop calling end users.  “No interest!”
- Risks and costs of implementation
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: IT is not your audience for this solution. LOB leaders are more receptive since they are the main beneficiaries. Getting rejected by IT motivated us to double down and reach CFO at all cost!!!
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT:
OAX for ERP delivered all pre-built components needed:
- Critical GL, AP, and AR reporting out of the box.
- Pre-built data pipeline and data model for the fastest and easiest connection to Fusion ERP. 
- Minimal effort and time to implement
- Nearly zero disruption to business
WINSTORY_USECASE: OAX for ERP - Single view of financial reporting. Combining data from finance and sales spreadsheet into “single vision of truth” for insights into forecast, projections, historical growth

WINSTORY_NAME: Emerson Energy: Analytics for ERP
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Emerson was struggling to provide valuable Financials and Supply Chain KPIS from their Cloud ERP environment to the executive level
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
1.	Matt Garibaldi engaged the Director of Supply Chain, owner of the current Oracle Analytics Cloud environment to ensure the Transportation use case was going as planned and to inform Emerson of our new Analytics for ERP solution
2.	Engaged Emerson with Product Management to discuss the benefits of using a pre-built solution vs build it yourself with Power BI

WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: The customer now does not have to manually extract,model, and deliver the data out of Cloud ERP to the executive/managers. This has saved Emerson significantly on FTE costs and their reliance on IT.

WINSTORY_NAME: Robertet: Move Workloads to IaaS & PaaS
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Robertet is an EBS customer that runs their environments on ODA’s. They recently expanded their data retention policy from 2 to 5 years, and currently use a 3rd party to host their storage and backup environments for EBS. The expansion of their data retention policy sparked the need for more server capacity and increased management cost from the 3rd party.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The account team worked with the Sr. Oracle Systems Manager and CIO to compare costs of hosting storage and backups on OCI vs the 3rd party. We were able to show the customer substantial immediate and long-term savings by migrating to OCI. After utilizing the cloud engineers to help the customer establish and test the network connection, the customer signed off on the deal. The customer has committed to a $30K ARR deal and has already expressed interest in expanding the environment for use in their disaster recovery strategy. The customer is also looking to explore an EBS lift & shift this FY. This was the customer’s first Oracle Cloud purchase. Their relationship with Oracle through their use of on-prem technology influenced this purchase.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Move workloads to IaaS & PaaS, ADW

WINSTORY_NAME: KPMG: Fusion Analytics for ERP
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: KPMG has a large Oracle SaaS environment, which includes Fusion ERP SaaS. They wanted to learn the latest in implementing more advanced analytics against the ERP system in a timely manner.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Once hearing about Fusion Analytics for ERP, and how it is a complete, out-of-the-box analytics package specifically built for Fusion with a backend of ADW, they were very excited to learn more. The customer liked the plug and play methodology and direct connections to their ERP to have the solution quickly up and running. Having the pre-built KPI catalogue for dashboarding was also a big value to them as it allows them to save the time and resources it takes to build custom dashboards. KPMG committed to a $27K 1 year deal, with plans to increase the department’s user count down the road and expand into other departments as well. KPMG is engaged with the Customer Success team to provision and set up their new Cloud environment. There are plans to work with the customer to expand user count, and to uncover more analytic workloads in additional Oracle SaaS environments in the HCM & SCM space as the Fusion Analytics roadmap progresses.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Fusion Analytics for ERP

WINSTORY_NAME: Del Monte Fresh Produce: APEX on ATP
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Andie.Fortune@oracle.com, Tania.Russakov@oracle.com, Vishwa.Jatania@oracle.com, Priyanka.Sancheti@oracle.com, David.Peake@oracle.com, Paras.Bhanse@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Del Monte Fresh Produce Co. was running legacy technology, Forms 6i, with about 14 years of data, 4,000 forms, and 1,000 reports. This was a project that needed to be done yesterday, according to upper management.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Prior to our first meeting with the customer, we knew they were analyzing three options: (1) .Net, (2) Forms and Reports 12c, and (3) doing nothing. We introduced them to two more options: APEX on-premise and APEX on ATP. The customer had specific criteria to make a decision: cost, license comparison, and conversion cost and time. Once understanding that, we had to sell the customer on APEX. We brought in David Peake who presented the ins and outs of APEX for two hours. After this conversation, it came down to a decision of on-premise vs. Cloud. Ultimately, the cost of Cloud along with the Consulting team resources that would help Del Monte onboard and learn the new technology made it clear that APEX on ATP was the right solution for them. The customer committed to $12k ARR for one year, plus 40 hours of Consulting to migrate their Forms 6i to APEX on ATP. They were able to have immediate cost savings of $16k, and $53k over the next three years.Del Monte has a development team doing work on their own to learn APEX. Vishwa is teaching them basics of Oracle Cloud, and Consulting is helping them develop an overall strategy for migrating all their forms and reports to this new technology. The Oracle team will continue to work with Del Monte with a goal of renewal Q4 FY21.
WINSTORY_USECASE: APEX on ATP

WINSTORY_NAME: Clearwater Paper/ Velocity Technology Solutions Win
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
• Clearwater Paper had been running JDE 9.0 on iSerie and 35+ Servers on an old Windows OS version. With a new CIO on board, it was time for CLW to modernize their IT environment and realize the benefits of cloud. 

• Clearwater was out of support on their iSeries beginning in Sept. 2019.  As a public company they cannot be unsupported and used this opportunity to modernize their JDE and turn to a cloud first strategy. 

• Required a partner that could not only upgrade their JD Edwards, take JDE and related applications to the cloud, replatform to a more strategic Oracle platform,  and also support the entire stack long term in a hybrid cloud environment.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
• OpenWorld presentation with Velocity JDE on OCI customer, Trugreen,  as well as Oracle was the trigger for CLW to engage Velocity. 

• Velocity’s experience with running JDE in OCI and AWS with specifc proof points on the performance advantages  of OCI was able to knock AWS out of consideration. 

• Numerous workshops to demonstrate the proof of performance to handle the entire project and ongoing management of the solution in a hybrid cloud solution.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: JDE client doing 9.2 upgrade and migration from IBM i-Series / Trusted advisor of the client, MSP /  Partner led move from Velocity Tech DC to OCI
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT:
• Velocity will be upgrading the JDE  apps to 9.2, replatform off of iSeries and upgrade all of their PaaS OS to the latest releases. 

• All apps will go into OCI with the exception of their EDI platform which is built on iSeries. The end result is a hybrid cloud solution with OCI and Velocity Private Data Center, all will be integrated and operate seamlessly for the CLW end users. 

 • CLW will realize a better level of service, lower level of risk, a great security posture, more economically viable solution that sets the company up for 2025 and beyond. 

• Oracle Cloud MSP enabled CLW to look towards 1 partner to handle everything along with guaranteed performance  SLA’s on a 3 yr. contract. 

• $120K  ARR initially, with cloud expansion planned.
WINSTORY_USECASE: OCI, Hybrid Cloud, JDE, iSeries Replatform

WINSTORY_NAME: JASCI / Mythics Win
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
Customer Overview : JASCI  is a ISV, with supply chain acceleration software created to meet the needs of omni-channel logistics via the cloud. JASCI  provides an all-encompassing Cloud Warehouse Management system with patent-pending Workflow Technology.

 

Business Challenge : JASCI is growing at an exponential rate, landing multiple customers per week. The company’s previous infrastructure, IBM Cloud, was unable to scale on demand, resulting in severe bottlenecking and management headaches.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
Partner Overview: Mythics is an award winning Oacle systems integrator, consulting firm, managed services provider. They are a member of the Oracle Partner Network representing Oracle product lines across cloud ( OPN expertise and certifications in resell and service )  , software, support, hardware, engineered systems and appliances ( OPN expertise and certifications in license and hardware ). Mythics delivers technology solutions serving the Federal Government, State and Local Governments, Commercial Higher Education and Research,

Utilities and Healthcare sectors and is a trusted partner to organizations worldwide.

 

Solution : In need of a highly-available solution capable of handling extreme throughput, the customer was quickly sold on the benefits of Exadata. When the topic of data management was presented, however, it became evident that an additional service was required. The CEO was adamant that he wanted to eliminate as many backend tasks as possible, which made his company the ideal candidate for Autonomous Transaction Processing. It was the perfect marriage of old and new, given that ATP runs on Exadata. The hook of autonomous innovation and the comfort of Exadata performance left Jasci convinced that Oracle is the cloud provider of the future.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Autonomous solution was able to  reduce customer cost, improve security, and eliminate manual processes.

 

Proper upfront planning on architecture design around networking/load balancing of web traffic was key to ensure high availability/redundancy to meet availability and performance requirements of Jasci.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Business Results : Jasci can onboard all new customers to Oracle Cloud, while simultaneously migrating existing customers off IBM. They’ve witnessed order processing improving by more than 100x compared to their previous cloud provider. Continue to look to expand their Oracle environment as they onboard new customers resulting in increased revenue potential to Oracle while also enhancing their application offering with other OCI solutions like Oracle Management Cloud and Analytics Cloud.
WINSTORY_USECASE:
Infrastructure on Oracle Cloud and eliminate manual processes through autonomous management

Rapid, highly-elastic infrastructure, with true multi-tenancy at the database level

WINSTORY_NAME: Snap-On / Fujitsu Win
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
SBS made the decision to move away from their current Oracle Managed Cloud Services (OMCS) to the new Oracle Cloud Infrastructure

SBS was looking for a partner that could provide the complete solution: • Transition Services to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure • Ongoing Workload Managed Services • Ongoing Strategic Data Base Services
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: As Oracle Cloud Managed Service Provider (MSP) Fujitsu team will complete the 3-month migration phase and will subsequently continue to deliver the 36 month strategic services such as: • OCI (IaaS) • Oracle Transition • Workload Managed Services and DBA Services (24x7x365) • Oracle Management Cloud for Monitoring • EBS Application Support

WINSTORY_NAME: 8 x 8: Selects Oracle as the Cloud Platform for its Secure Video Meeting Solutions
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Lucia.Gonzalez@oracle.com, Mary.Hadinger@oracle.com, Will.Childs@oracle.com, Dave.Profozich@oracle.com, Dawood.Masma@oracle.com, Prasanna.Rajagopal@oracle.com, Chandra.Salem@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: As COVID-19 spread, 8x8’s private and secure video meetings solutions were exceeding 20 million monthly active users worldwide and serving 1.5 petabytes of video data daily.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: A POC environment was quickly provisioned and run thanks to the herculean efforts of the SC team, who worked weekends and led 5 AM calls to ensure a successful POC.  It was. Special thanks to Dawood Masma and Prasanna Rajagopal.  Following the POC and a few final negotiations, the deal was signed on April 10, not even four weeks after Lucia’s initial call.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Whether you’re a seasoned field salesperson or new to the role, there are a number of best practices from this win you could replicate with your ISVs.  Here are a few:

•	Continuous Research
•	1x1 Mapping, Accountability and Ownership  
•	Flexibility and Fast

Our best work starts after the contract is signed.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: 8 x 8 selects Oracle as the Cloud Platform for its Secure Video Meeting Solutions

WINSTORY_NAME: Altair: All future HPC shapes and workloads will now go on OCI
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Bart.Brotsos@oracle.com, Mark.Hura@oracle.com, Dave.Profozich@oracle.com, Simon.Jeacock@oracle.com, Shirley.Hunter@oracle.com, Tejas.Karmarkar@oracle.com, Amarendra.Joshi@oracle.com, Karan.Batta@oracle.com, Abhi.Chitnis@oracle.com, Tim.Caster@oracle.com, Jeet.Jagasia@oracle.com, David.Hicks@oracle.com, Michele.Vezza@oracle.com, Mary.Hadinger@oracle.com, Keith.Hurwitz@oracle.com, Max.Masino@oracle.com, Simon.Jeacock@oracle.com, Kwan.YeeSommerville@oracle.com, Jesalie.Juarez@oracle.com, Kyle.Donigan@oracle.com, Heather.Pelley@oracle.com, Abby.Christopher@oracle.com, George.Davis@oracle.com, Sorin.Raita@oracle.com, Ionut.Sturzu@oracle.com, Emanuel.Grama@oracle.com, Bogdan.Darie@oracle.com, Daniel.Niculae@oracle.com, Ionel.Panaitescu@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Altair was increasingly keen on partnering with Oracle and, importantly, was in the final year of their contract with Azure.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Oracle set up a 30-day sprint P2P with the Test-Dev team in Altair’s Product Development Group.  Test results revealed that OCI was performing exceptionally and consistently registered 25% better throughput versus on-prem.  Before the conclusion of the P2P, the ISV Rep asked for the deal.  His move worked and he simultaneously doubled the TCV by extending a price hold in exchange for Altair porting another app
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Thinking Strategically:  This deal was the product of well-structured and successive, strategic decisions across the board. Two deserve special mention: capitalizing on Altair’s contract expiration with Azure and doubling the deal size by offering a price hold in exchange for another workload.  Opportunity was realized and value was captured in a mutually beneficial way. 
 
 Collaboration: Big deals are complex and require an entire team to engage multiple partner touch-points.  Bart collaborated with several Oracle teams, spanning OCI Product Management, ISV Ecosystem Sales Consulting, Business Development, Marketing and more.  
 
 Executive Alignment: Connecting with executives and subsequently establishing executive-to-executive alignment was key.  Mark Hura’s introduction to Altair’s CEO, coupled with Dave Profozich’s continual engagement, as well as a Q3 joint customer win at Fiat Chrysler, got
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Test results revealed that OCI was performing exceptionally and consistently registered 25% better throughput versus on-prem.
WINSTORY_USECASE: All future HPC shapes and workloads will now go on OCI

WINSTORY_NAME: Gavilon: Essbase from OCI-C to ATP/OCI
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Austin.Hart@oracle.com, Trevor.Davies@oracle.com, Ryan.Lever@oracle.com, Matt.Garibaldi@oracle.com, Sarah.Zumbrum@oracle.com, Vishwa.Jatania@oracle.com, Rawud.Manasseh@oracle.com, Samuel.Cacela@oracle.com, Selene.Song@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: The Gavilon Group had their Essbase environment on OCI-C with a contract end date coming up in Q1 alongside their SaaS ERP investment.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: They had had not committed to renewing Essbase and wanted to evaluate options up until the renewal date in July. We were able to create urgency on their side by providing language in the proposed contract to allow them to start the mid-term conversion to OCI, while keeping the Classic environment running for 120 days during the migration. The Gavilon Group saw the value we proposed, along with the discount associated with a long-term commit. The CIO signed off on a three year contract for $60k ARR/180k TCV for ATP and OCI. They are still evaluating Oracle as a vendor for an Enterprise Data Warehouse and we are proposing Fusion Analytics for ERP to allow them to store Essbase, ERP, and other internal data in ADW while getting enhanced analytics.
WINSTORY_USECASE: a.	Migrate current Essbase environment from OCI-C to ATP/OCI

WINSTORY_NAME: Canada Life: Exadata Cloud@Customer
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Chad.Blickenstaff@oracle.com, Bei.Yu@oracle.com, Robert.Mackett@oracle.com, Jim Scott@oracle.com, Andre.Tardiff@oracle.com, Tim.Donaldson@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Canada Life’s Investments division needed to become more agile to adapt to the fast paced, volatile market conditions and build upon their industry leading success. They were looking to find a solution that would allow investments to scale up/down to align to peak trading metrics, enable the rapid deployment of technology for future growth initiatives, and increase performance and improve user experience while reducing cost. Competition: IBM/EMC
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Our in-depth POC with Investment’s business users combined with Hub capabilities substantiated our Cloud capabilities. IT executives understood our business and architectural value proposition and sponsored the incumbent change and technology adoption. $5.8m CDN over 4 years for our Oracle solution that includes Exadata Cloud at Customer and Oracle ZFS. Customer refers to the solution as the “Oracle Ecosystem Solution” that will be leveraged for future use cases. Once in production, targeted for a number of already identified use cases.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: It takes a village: Chad Blickenstaff (CPR), Bei Yu (CPR Manager), Robert Mackett (Field Manager), Jim Scott (KAD), Andre Tardiff (Director, Cloud Consulting), Anil Kowshik (Enterprise System Strategist), Bruce Davis (Server Sales Rep), Dmitry Khait (Master Principal Cloud Consultant), Flordeliza Capule (Deal Project Manager), Kara Stermitz (Complex Deal Strategy Manager), Lorraine Depolo (Business Operations), Lorrainne Mascarenhas (Manager, Deal Mangaement), Noman Manasiya (Deal Specialist), Richard Lopez (Deal Specialist), Rod Thacker (Senior Managing Counsel), Tim Donaldson (Field CPR)
WINSTORY_USECASE: Exadata Cloud@Customer

WINSTORY_NAME: TrueBlue: ATP & OIC
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: TrueBlue purchased Fusion Analytics ERP in Q3 – becoming one of the first customers to adopt it – but soon realized they needed to connect more data sources than just ERP. They have various smaller applications with important financial data that would provide value to them if it was all analyzed in one location. To connect more data sources, we leveraged ATP as intermediate databases/storage for Oracle Integration Cloud, and ran a two-week SE assisted trial to test it.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: TrueBlue purchased enough UCC Credits for two instances of OIC Enterprise and two ATP databases. Instances are being spun up with help of the Product Management team, NAC Consulting is involved to help set up the UCC portion and build out the integrations/provision the ATP database, and Accenture is helping with implementation.
WINSTORY_USECASE: ATP as intermediate databases/storage for Oracle Integration Cloud

WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Diversey had an Essbase subscription that was never fully provisioned. The customer had plans to move their workload to the Cloud, but decided to wait until the new version of Essbase was released.

After learning about the scalable and flexible infrastructure and cost model, they decided to purchase Essbase 19c. WINSTORY_NAME: Clean Harbors: OAC, ADW
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Miles.Bribriesco@oracle.com, Craig.Nichols@oracle.com, Haroon.Choudhry@oracle.com, Mike.Slomba@oracle.com, Patrick.Fogoros@oracle.com, Robert.Sheldon@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Clean Harbors had legacy Peoplesoft, third party, and homegrown applications that were stagnating the business. They were experiencing issues in managing HR, Supply Chain, Financial, M&A, and other types of data. Clean Harbors’ CEO led an initiative to improve upon these processes by investing in a unified solution.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Clean Harbors began evaluating Oracle SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS in late 2018. Over this time, there have been multiple presentations led by SaaS and Cloud team directly to Clean Harbors CEO and senior IT leadership. We presented a unified approach to cover all of their needs, specifically in Finance, Supply Chain, Talent Management, Data Storage, AI/ML, etc. Despite delays related to Covid-19, Oracle sales teams were able to work together to present discounts that fit the customer’s budget. Clean Harbors invested $720k ($144k ARR) in UCC credits to be used for OAC and ADW to improve upon analytics, data storage and security for HCM, ERP, SCM. We are concurrently implementing SaaS, ADW, and OAC to provide a unified architecture. This is a great opportunity for Oracle to continue to build upon data storage and analytical workloads moving forward.
WINSTORY_USECASE: OAC and ADW to build richer analytics and data storage for Oracle SaaS

WINSTORY_NAME: OFS Fitel: ADW with Goldengate & ODI
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: OFS Fitel currently uses ODI to replicate tables between two Oracle on-premise databases - one supporting their SAP ERP application, and one acting as a data warehouse.  They were interested in using GoldenGate to replicate the entire SAP schema to the data warehouse to reduce the load on the source SAP database and improve efficiency of the team and speed of delivery to the data warehouse.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Director of Global IT was seeking a quote for GoldenGate on-premise licenses – their current environment was on-premise, and they were more familiar with these tools. The Cloud team fought for a discovery call and learned that OFS moves data to their data warehouse and then distributes the data to a mix of cloud and on-premise applications, such as Salesforce, a demand planning application, scheduling systems, and some custom C# and .NET applications. Many of these processes were convoluted, and they needed guidance on creating a simpler future state. We proposed a future state architecture with ADW as the data warehouse, redistributing data to their BI tool and other applications with GoldenGate and ODI in the cloud.  We took advantage of the promotion for free GoldenGate and ODI on OCI Marketplace to ultimately win the deal. Customer agreed to a $12K ARR deal for UCC with substantial room for growth as they add more data sources. A deal like this would typically have a much longer sales cycle, but the customer committed to get the deal done in May, recognizing the efforts of our team. This is OFS Fitel’s first Oracle Cloud deal and happened very rapidly, so we are working to familiarize the customer with our Cloud interface and establish a connection between their on-premise database and new data warehouse. From there, we will connect to their ancillary applications and take advantage of the MS Interconnect to connect their Power BI tool.  Once this original project is completed, we will look to replicate their JDE ERP into the data warehouse.
WINSTORY_USECASE: ADW with Goldengate & ODI

WINSTORY_NAME: National Gypsum: Modernize Essbase with ATP
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: National Gypsum had an Essbase PAYG that lacked the reporting functionality they needed. They were also facing a few technical problems with the environment.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: By moving from PAYG to a Monthly Commit, Gypsum was able to add OAC Data Visualization for reporting functionality. This was done with the power of OCI and ATP. In addition to reporting, we were able to fix the technical issues with their original Essbase PAYG environment, and now they have a unified Monthly commit model. Moving forward, we will continue working with the Gypsum team to add further analytical capabilities.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Modernize Essbase with ATP

WINSTORY_NAME: PayPal: Lift-and-Shift Essbase to OCI, ATP
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: PayPal was using Essbase 12 on-prem and had an outdated version of the application with high maintenance cost.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: We analyzed their options and discovered that we could upgrade their Essbase to version 19C while also shifting the application to run in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. The added benefits of Essbase 19C plus the ability to run this application in OCI with ATP provided cost savings and performance benefits. PayPal purchased Essbase 19C to run in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. ATP is being used for data staging in OCI and to run the Essbase application in OCI.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Moving forward, we will be implementing the new solution and making sure the customer has all the tools they need to benefit from their new solutions.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Lift-and-Shift Essbase to OCI (upgrade to 19C); ATP for data staging

WINSTORY_NAME: FedEx: FY20Q4 Autonomous / OCI / Engineered System / Analytics
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
Lower Data Center Footprint – FedEx wants to get out of the data center business yet be able to modernize their legacy applications by taking advantage of cloud technologies.  We’re moving a lot of their custom apps running on Oracle database to OCI 

Improve Performance For Enterprise Applications – $70B of business run through their EBS environment and performance has been a key issue for their back-office applications.  By moving EBS to OCI, FedEx can leverage the performance of Oracle’s engineered system in Exadata and leverage PaaS for integration both for on prem and cloud

Business Intelligence – The growing amount of siloed data at FedEx has been a challenge to be able to integrate cross data sources and perform key financial analysis.  There’s been a need to create a true data platform and build an analytics engine on top that can deliver accurate and meaningful information.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
Cloud Consumption Analysis – We conducted bi-weekly health checks with FedEx on how they’ve been consuming on OCI which was a very important exercise to be able to understand their past and current usage of cloud.  This then drove the discussion towards future needs analysis and planning.  FedEx has under consumed in their 1st year of using OCI and we were determined to understand the ‘why’ and ensure moving forward that we drive towards full consumption. 

Drive Engagement Activity – The sales team including ECA and Hub Engineers made it a mission to meet with different LOBs across FedEx to drive the value of OCI through various series and combination of webinars, roadshows, workshops, CVC and executive presentations.  

CVC – We held a 2-day CVC with FedEx finance in HQ in order to discuss the value of OCI and the benefits that we can deliver by modernizing their EBS back office application.  This was a very important step to get FedEx leadership by in for doing a POC on OCI

Business Cases – The Oracle Business Value team built two key business cases for FedEx.  The first was prove the business benefits of moving EBS to OCI for finance.   We built a second business case for FedEx CDAS to prove out the benefits of moving PeopleSoft to OCI.  Both of these use cases were included as part of the scope in expanding the FedEx UCC contract

Proof Of Concepts – The ECA, Sales Team, and ACS collaborated and worked on a very successful POC to prove out the performance benefits of running EBS on OCI.  We had to transfer over 100TB of data using Fast Connect onto OCI in order to conduce the POC.  We also conducted a second POC with the FedEx CDAS group in testing OCI for their PeopleSoft HR Payroll application.  

Cloud Consumption Growth Planning – The sales team and ECA team met with different operating companies under FedEx to understand their current and future needs on cloud and determine their overall demand on OCI.  By identifying all of their projects we were able to build a plan for each of their projects including BOMs and ultimately consolidated the messaging with FedEx finance to deliver the full scope of their demand across FedEx.  

Contracts And Negotiation – Sales leadership and their sponsorship as well as the help of our approvers and contracts team was key in getting the buy in from FedEx to move forward with the expansion and extension of their UCC contract.  The result was a May FY21 deal which was $40mil of new revenue to Oracle.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Planning And Execution:  The sales team continuously planned and put a strategy together that we all agreed on to execute.  It was important we stayed together as a team and trust the strategy we put in place that ultimately drove the result of this win. That included having an account plan and a close plan.   

Leverage All Resources:  We all need to continue and leverage every resource we have at Oracle to win large deals like FedEx. 

Win Your Customer’s Trust:  Our work in cloud does not end when FedEx signed the contract.  The work only begins so it’s important to stay engaged, create a consumption plan with FedEx and drive continuous activity.  This helped to build trust and helped in driving the additional investment FedEx made on OCI.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: By expanding and extending their UCC contract, FedEx can continue and leverage the power of OCI to advance their projects and fulfill the cloud first strategy.  FedEx will be able to modernize legacy applications, lower their data center footprint, and build a data platform for advance analytics to continue to drive value out of their business.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Autonomous / OCI / Engineered System / Analytics

WINSTORY_NAME: Sabre: OCI
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: After outlining the technical and strategic values of OCI, Jason engaged Bob Robinson’s to help conduct a TCO analysis of OCI versus GCP, which showed OCI to be 54% cheaper.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Partnership:  From the beginning, Jason and the team were laser-focused on nurturing a long-term partnership with Sabre.  When Sabre’s back was up against the wall, the Oracle ISV Ecosystem team stepped in to support them in their time of need.  From the vast technical resources and favorable commercial terms to the expedited contracting process, Oracle showed Sabre what partnership means to us. 
 
 Flexibility:  This deal took many unexpected twists and turns.  The team constantly went in with a plan only to dynamically adjust, change tactics and reposition their strategy.  The deal literally was booked with a travel company during a global pandemic.  If the team were not able to change, and do so quickly, this deal probably would not have closed. 
 
 Empathy:  This was a tense time for everyone on the planet.  There were multiple times where the Oracle team could have lost their cool, or not respond professionally because the customer wasn’t being as forthcoming or collaborative as hoped.  However, the team managed to control their emotions, demonstrate empathy for their partner’s predicament and ultimately land the deal.
WINSTORY_USECASE:
OCI - VM Compute, Windows OS, Bare Metal,  CS, ExaCS, FastConnect
LoadBalancerCS

WINSTORY_NAME: Baptist Health: ADW/OAC for PeopleSoft (Financials & Covid/Personal Protection Equipment)
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Mary Beth Segerlind@oracle.com, Will.OBriant@oracle.com, Mike.Bielinski@oracle.com, Robert.Kalinka@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Baptist was using Qlik and was unsuccessful with extracting the data that they needed from their PeopleSoft environment.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Baptist originally purchased OAC/ADW in 2018.  It was a highly technical implementation that did not  have the right resources on the customer side to get up and running.  The customer was extremely frustrated when I met them and was not willing to renew.  My analytics rep and I  earned their trust  and ensured them that we would put the proper teams in place for a successful outcome.  We worked closely with OCS, Product Development and the Cloud Architect teams to identify a path forward and thus far have received very positive feedback from the customer .
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Never give up on an unhappy customer.  If you believe in what we have to offer and  stay committed, they will come around.  Baptist had said they will become a reference for us once they go live.  They are very happy with the progress we have made thus far.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Baptist will be able to track important information ex: PPE equipment during COVID-19.  They were able to find more use cases for OAC which has increased their enthusiasm.

WINSTORY_NAME: HighJump: Supply chain logistics, warehouse management, third party logistics
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Read the Win Wire in the Collateral Tab
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Read the Win Wire in the Collateral Tab
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Investing in Long-Term Partnership: This deal came from Oracle’s consistent and broad-based investment in a deep partnership with HighJump.  From earning Global Cloud ISV of 2019, to the technical workshops and the conference collaboration, our two companies get increasingly closer, achieving mutually beneficial technical and financial wins. 
 
 Leveraging Oracle Leadership:  HighJump has benefited from multiple executive-level relationships across the ISV organization.  Bart, however, made sure not to stop here and leveraged the deep expertise of the OCI Product Management team to help drive this deal.  In fact, they are hosting another OCI workshop in May for several of HighJump’s divisions globally to highlight how OCI helped implementation times from 2-3 months to 2-3 days. 
 
 Flexibility:  Bart understood where HighJump was coming from and worked with his partner to find a solution that was mutually beneficial.  Then, when HighJump needed time to obtain final approval, Oracle was patient, offering assurance, information and resources to numerous members of HighJump’s management team.

WINSTORY_NAME: Net Insight: Analytics on top of ADW
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Peter.Clifford@oracle.com, Dom.Serramy@oracle.com, Krupa.Srinivasan@oracle.com, Sandip.Rana@oracle.com, Peter.Arnal@oracle.com, Daniel.Arsenault@oracle.com, Brian.Foley@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER:
Net Insight is a growing Company with approximately $40 million in revenue. They want to provide their customers with more complex analytics to provide real insights from all the scheduling data they gather. They will be embedding OAC in their new release of “ScheduALL” which is their resource management platform. This was a highly competitive deal against Microsoft who was initially pushed by Net Insight executives and is currently used by a number of their customers to analyze data.
They are looking to re-architect their “ScheduAll” intelligent resource management and optimization application with micro services and analytics.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: The first stage of the project was analytics with a data warehouse. Tech and Analytics teams worked closely with the CTO to show a POC, we were able to show a demonstration of their product at a massive industry trade show and the feedback they got from their potential customers was very positive.  This was instrumental in closing the deal.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT: Oracle was able to provide a more complete- clean offering that exceeded the customer’s expectations. In addition to offering a superior solution; the high level of customer service provided by Oracle employees at every level through the entire process played a critical role and will continue to as we look to “land & expand.”
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: Did you know... Net Insight uses Autonomous Data Warehouse to make their streaming platform available as a service to their global broadcasting customers. This enables their customers to optimize their investments on events like the Olympics and Super Bowl – saving millions of dollars on equipment and personnel through real-time insights and analytics.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Analytics on top of ADW

WINSTORY_NAME: McAfee: Enterprise Security Manager Cloud
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: While OCI’s technical merits interested McAfee – particularly considering the importance of scale and performance for their SIEM solution – the iterative discussions around collaborative demand generation ultimately compelled McAfee to invest.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: Last February Ben Martella (ISV Ecosystem Rep) and Will Childs (ISV Ecosystem BD) met with senior McAfee leadership to learn more about their cloud transformation objectives, which were starting to take shape.  Following this meeting, the ISV account team conducted numerous collaborative sessions with McAfee C-level executives and business heads to brainstorm ways Oracle could partner with McAfee to provide technical and demand generation differentiation.  This partnership-focused approach encouraged McAfee to open up and share board-level strategic goals, initiatives and growth targets.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Partnership-Focused Engagement:  The Oracle ISV account team structured every interaction to create a long-term, mutually-beneficial partnership.  This was not a one-off commercial transaction.  Collaborating and co-investing based on mutual success - not just Oracle success - creates a deep level of commitment at the most senior levels within both companies.   
 
 Quantifying Potential Results:  Modeling potential financial outcomes was critical to landing this deal.  Oracle and McAfee collaborated deeply to develop a sales/marketing and finance plan, modelling projected revenues, addressable markets and holistic costs involved in bringing new services to market.   
 
 Collaborative Selling: This was a very complex process, requiring the combined efforts of Ben Martella, Will Childs, Umesh Patel, Dave Profozich, and numerous Product Management teams. Look to leverage the deep expertise found across the entirety of Oracle, not just the ISV organization.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: One of McAfee’s key strategic objectives was revenue growth.  As conversations progressed, McAfee came to see Oracle as a true partner that could help them accelerate cloud change and realize their strategic goals faster.  McAfee decided to formalize the partnership by leveraging the ISV Accelerate framework, and the deal was signed in November.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Enterprise Security Manager Cloud - OCI

WINSTORY_NAME: Workforce: OCI - Workforce Management Software (HCM)
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: Workforce was having performance and related cost issues with their Azure environments and was also still hosting from five co-location facilities.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS:
Jon asked for the opportunity to educate Workforce on OCI and met with Workforce’s VP of Cloud Services.  Workforce quickly became interested in conducting a POC.  Workforce also was willing to share their 20,000 lineitemed Azure bill for the preceding three months.  With the help of Bob Robinson, the sales team found that OCI was 67% less expensive (at standard OCI pricing).  The team did the same analysis on Workforce’s co-location facilities, and discovered OCI was still 30% cheaper. 
 
Workforce wanted to verify these findings as part of their POC.  Following successful completion of the POC, and solely based on OCI’s price-performance merits, Workforce’s VP of Cloud Services wanted to sign a multi-million dollar ARR deal in Q2.  Right before approving the contract, though, Workforce’s CEO became interested in exploring potential GTM collaboration with Oracle.  After extensive discussions involving Safra Katz, Dave Profozich, Doug Kehring and Oracle HCM Product Management, Workforce leveraged the Accelerate Framework and signed a much larger, longerterm deal.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Well-Executed Sales Process:  The team leveraged an internal champion at Workforce to get a meeting with key Workforce decision makers, where they positioned and then quantified the advantages of running on OCI.  The team then proved these advantages with a successful POC, and subsequently positioned Accelerate after further qualifying Workforce’s interest in GTM.  
 
 Partner-Focused Engagement: Oracle’s consultative-approach was a key differentiator here. The team was laser-focused on joint success, positioned Oracle as a partner whose solutions empowered Workforce, patiently educated them on OCI, and dynamically adjusted to the customer’s needs. Workforce was particularly delighted to hear that Oracle would host daily migration calls post-engagement and stay heavily engaged post-sale.   
 
 Cross-Functional Collaboration: To close this deal, Jon and team leveraged the expertise of numerous individuals across the Oracle ISV Ecosystem org, and in different product line organizations, such as HCM.  In addition, after the sale there has been considerable upselling with the team tapping domain experts in Oracle Management Cloud, Oracle Analytics Cloud, Oracle integration and chat bots to explore new potential deals with Workforce.
WINSTORY_CUSTOMER_IMPACT: WorkForce Software saw mor than 30% increase in performance improvements
WINSTORY_USECASE: OCI - Workforce Management Software (HCM)

WINSTORY_NAME: RecVue: Migration to Oracle Gen 2 Infrastructure (OCI)
WINSTORY_REPS_SE: Chris.Chersi@oracle.com , Paul.Difani@oracle.com, Sonali.Malik@oracle.com, Thomas.Liakos@oracle.com, Rajendra.Gade@oracle.com, Pavani.Vajhala@oracle.com
WINSTORY_BUSSINESS_DRIVER: In mid-June 2019, Oracle ISV account rep Chris Chersi realized that RecVue had a contract renewal in November.  He also noticed that RecVue were consistently out-spending their budget on OCI-Classic and saw a great opportunity to migrate RecVue to Oracle Gen 2 Infrastructure (OCI).  With enhanced priceperformance on OCI and a rapidly-expanding portfolio of platform services, Chris knew that RecVue could do much more for a lower price on our Gen 2 Infrastructure.
WINSTORY_SALES_PROCESS: To prove this, Chris analyzed RecVue’s spending patterns and calculated the base-rate savings possible under a new contract for OCI.  Next, he selected platform services, such as Autonomous Database, newly available on Gen 2 that aligned with RecVue’s business growth needs. What followed was a sequence of thoughtful, data-driven conversations with RecVue leadership, which eventually persuaded RecVue to commit to Oracle Cloud for multiple years.  Importantly, Chris obtained the necessary approvals to allow for a 120 day migration period and a 30% discount on the rate card.
WINSTORY_LESSON_LEARNT:
Quantifying Results: After analyzing customer usage and cross-referencing RecVue’s business needs, Chris created spreadsheets quantifying how much could be saved if RecVue switched to OCI Gen 2 and expanded their consumption. While some assumptions were needed, and Chris had to be resourceful in knowing Oracle’s offerings and where internal discount breaks were, these datadriven models formed the deal’s bedrock.  
 
 Customer Education: An important driver in increasing the deal value was educating RecVue on what they can do with us, and the flexibility they have on Oracle.  It was through this process that RecVue were introduced to, and are now trialing, Autonomous Database and other services. 
 
 Trust & Partnership Building:  The net result of Chris’ proactivity, data-driven analysis and customer education was deep trust and an incredibly strong partnership.  RecVue knew that Chris had their best interests at heart and that Oracle was more than willing to work with them.
WINSTORY_USECASE: Migration to Oracle Gen 2 Infrastructure (OCI)
